Reviews.Title: “Good Location Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahsmumOswestry
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from another trip to Rome (our 7th!), we love the city and we know it well. We have stayed in various hotels - but we were happy to return to it. Our choices are made very much by price and also by using these reviews, so we're aware of the importance of being honest and impartial. This hotel was excellent value for money. The service afforded by all staff in this hotel, was by far of a level one would expect from a hotel costing far more, yet it was so personal and in no way was it contrived. We had booked a standard double, but on checking in we were surprised to be offerred a free upgrade to a superior room, situated in a new area of the building. This is an annex, and, although we thought it a bit odd, initially, that we had to go out of the main hotel and two doors down, this feeling left us immediately, when we were taken into a beautiful bright room, spotlessly clean, and although overlooking the road called Via Boncompagni - which is the fairly busy road leading onto the Via Veneto, you could barely hear a thing - being quite high up, but also due to the quality of the window glass. Breakfast was taken in the main hotel on the 7th floor in a roof terrace conservatory - affording amazing views over the city - even as far as the Vatican on the clearer day. A substantial spread was offerred the usual continental style - fresh rolls, meats, cheese, jams, cake, etc, and there were endless fresh cappucino's and espressos made to order. Having made our own way to the hotel by train and taxi from the airport, we discovered that it would have been cheaper to let the hotel organise our transfer. The gentleman on the desk (Gianni) ordered us a taxi which arrived ten minutes later and was sure to remind us to check the fixed price before travelling and also ensured we knew the name of the firm providing the taxi, thus ensuring that his clients were correctly taken care of. It's little things like this that stay in your mind. We will definately use this hotel again, next year when we make our annual trip. Thank you to all the staff who made it so comfortable and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ioannis C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Small room but every day was cleaned . Near to the center . In a few distance by foot to see many of the the sightseeings of Rome . The price of the room should be little cheaper .

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: jen91
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in March. Location is business district with no restaurants around; go to the via veneto for that. Room nice with huge tube, Italian only tv, decent staff. Expensive for what you get. Nice rooftop breakfast, but it is totally enclosed, no fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Gianni!”
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 2 nights and it was wonderful. The front desk manager, Gianni, was incredibly helpful and polite, giving us detailed information on everything we needed for our stay, as well as making the hotel as accommodating as possible. He even let us check in VERY early, when we arrived before we expected. The hotel is very clean and stylish, with nice floors and a great view from the breakfast area. Pure and simple, it is worth staying at!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kay199
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Veneto for five nights in March 2012. Check in was quite simple and straightforward. The room we were given was an average European sized room, relatively small and pokey. One bedside cabinet and no access from one side of the bed. Decor of the room was nice, however the only mirror in the bedroom, other than the one in the bathroom was against a wall above the bed. The shower was small and claustrophobic, with a dial with six very confusing settings. Each morning we wore woken by the maids at around 8 o'clock, who were banging things around, talking loudy amongst themselves, with no regard for the time and guests in the rooms. The walls were paper thin. The best thing about this hotel was location, everywhere was pretty much within walking distance or a tube ride away.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smudge1962
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, staff where all very friendly @helpful, very near all the attractions,would definitely,recommend this hotel to anybody, more like a 5 star

Reviews.Title: “Nice taste of Roma”
Reviews.Author: NWsnowPro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Veneto for three nights towards the end of March 2012. The hotel room was a typically European room (small), but nice decor. The walls were covered in this sort of padded wallpaper, which gave it a nice, retro style look. Bed was a bit too firm for my wife's liking. We also had left the window open when we slept to get a slight breeze, but this made for a very noisy (early) morning. The bathroom was good. Comes with a bidet. Probably my favorite part about this place was the breakfast. It's in a great room on the roof of the hotel next door (the two hotels are connected by a hallway), so you get a great view of the city. The food is great too.. lots of pastries and different meats and some cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: unz_10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived in Rome in March for a long weekend. The room was very nicely decorated and our bath and shower had jets. We were staying on the 3rd floor so not much noise outside but we could hear noise from all sides of our room, it was loud in the mornings but it didnt bother us to much. The location of the hotel is very good, within walking distance of attactions and transport. Staff were very pleasant. There were some really nice restaurants nearby also. We got a cheap rate for the hotel it was great! very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: martine s
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my teenager daughter Gianni at the front desk was outstanding with his helpfullness his great directions made all the difference to our trip. Room was very clean and clean linnen everyday, wonderful breakfast served on the 7th floor overlooking Rome with very friendly staff. Hotel was within a short walking distance from everything you need such as transportation, restaurants, night life. 100% recommendation we had a wonderful holiday and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mummy1330
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last minute for one night so got a excellent rate online , compared to what was quoted over the phone Very clean , Very friendly staff , each of them we came to speak to Room we had was perfect size , shower with jets was FAB ! about 5-6 streets from Trevi fountain Perfect for us

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Roya8
Reviews.Content: Thank u very much for such lovely personal))It was so grateful tostay in this hotel) it situates notin exactly center of the city but very close to it . Old atmosphere of the hotel was very impressive. Thanks a lot

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room size, loved the bathroom, it was close to the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: shari C
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel just our last night the quad is a great size for a family. I would stay here again I liked where it was located near the center of town. The bathroom had a great shower and a great size for a family. Loved the decor and the common areas where really pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Veneto and Rome - To book or not to book?”
Reviews.Author: MSR186605
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome - stayed at Hotel Veneto. Our flight was in at 10.30 am, booked Romecabs for transfer. Driver was waiting as promised at the "orange meeting point". She was holding folder with my name on it. Confirmed name and destination. Had very little english which was fine as I am not much of a small talker anyway. Took us to the hotel and pointed out a few sites on the way. Took just under an hour to get there (from Da Vinci FCO). As we were too early for check in, the staff of the hotel advised room would not be ready for a while which we understood. He gave us a map of the area and took our bags for safekeeping. Afraid my map skills are as good as my talking skills ...... headed in a direction that I hoped would bring me to a main street, eventually it did. Hotel is not central as advised on web sites. You will WALK A LOT to see all. Headed for what I would call a square and saw many open top buses. Took one of these (think the bus chain was called stop 110) as thought this would be the best way of getting my bearings. The charge for the tour was E18 but the ticket was good for 48 hrs. Headphones were also provided. There are different lanuages spoken so you need to select the correct language (4 for english). Full tour lasted about 2 hrs and you can hop on and hop off if you wish. I stayed on to see all the sites, so next day I could walk to them. Got back to hotel, room was ready. Asked for the state tax amount immediately (E3 per person per day of stay - ie. 2 people staying for 3 days = E18). Advised to go ahead and our bags would be dropped up. This was done immediately. The young man also showed us how to work the a/c. The room was very small and the decor would probably be considered old fashioned but it served its purpose. The staff were friendly any time we meet any. Room was cleaned every day, clean towels provided, very good shower (again small but powerful). Breakfast was in another hotel connected by steps (could not use the elevator in Veneto for breakfast room) - no big deal just had to go to reception from your floor go down a few steps climb a few steps and get another elevator - in was on the roof top (covered by glass), beautiful views, it was served from 7 to 10 - cold meats, cheese, bread, rolls, juices, yogurts, croissants, jams, cakes, tea & coffee available, again sufficient to keep you going for a few hours. The shops are divane, there were sales on 50-70% off, I recommend bringing an empty bag for check in, you will shop till you drop. Food and drink are expensive there. In restaurants, there is a service charge added onto the bill, think this was 21%, it is then up to you whether or not you want to tip. Good english by most of the waiters. Sights are fabulous, well worth the visit. To sum up - tips - bring comfortable walking shoes - you will do a lot of walking bring plenty money - you will shop a lot

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_JF
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to many of the must see attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “small boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kerry g
Reviews.Content: Very clean room. Generally, the english language been spoken at the front desk was pretty poor for people who are in the tourism/ hotel business. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in room. Although this doesnt sound serious it does become serious as every drink you want has to be purchased out. The breakfasts were through in another hotel and the passage to this hotel smelt bad, maybe some plumbing issues? I would say this hotel is nice little boutique hotel suitable for locals. I would not recommend it for tourists as its missing too many creature comforts including views, condiments, understandable staff, and really didnt fell that safe.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel but a little off the beaten track.”
Reviews.Author: bellini64
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly clean and even though we paid for a superior room, we weren't quite sure what the difference was between that and the standard. Our room faced over air conditioning units so not the prettiest view, but that meant we weren't disturbed by the traffic. The bedrooms were quite elaborate in decor and clean. Despite recent renovations, there were still small chunks of plaster off the wall and raw plugs visible so a little TLC is needed to keep it up to standard. Breakfast was through in the adjoining hotel Romantica up on the 7th floor so the views were excellent. During the warmer months, I guess they open up the terrace which I'm sure is a great advantage. We found the breakfast to be more than adequate (for Europe) but suggest you get them to make your coffee to order (capuccino/expresso) rather than take the ready made stuff. It was a little away from the main attractions so we opted to stay out all day and only return later at night. The staff were okay - checking in was slow with only 1 lady on the desk answering calls and handling guests. Overall we were satisfied with this hotel as a base to explore Rome but next time will book something a bit closer to town/more central.

Reviews.Title: “B-DAY TRIP TO ROME! AVERAGE HOTEL WITH EXCELLENT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: MaroThai
Reviews.Content: Reading all comments of this hotel before booking I was a little bit scared of what we will meet. However i can say that this is an average hotel with good location and very good service from the staff. Room was a little bit small but very clean..you can smell it!! The housekeeping department did a great job! Every day they changed our towels and linen...Bathroom updated and carefully cleaned. Our shower had a jacuzzi which we enjoyed much! Our room didn't have a view (interior room) but we didn't really care as when you are in Rome you will be for sure all day out for sight-seeing! This hotel from the web site looks a bit better but that's ok...not very disappointing.. Breakfast was ok...not someting special, no hot dishes like eggs bacon etc...but they offer also capuccino for free...I am sure that (after so many days of checking availability & rates through internet for hotels in Rome) I made the best choice...and this because I had a tight budget (max 85-90 euro per night B/B-which for Rome hotels believe me is little money) and I wanted a centrally located hotel so we can do everything on foot. However almost outside of the hotel there is a bus stop which you can use to be transfered in many areas in Rome. Hotel Veneto has a sister Hotel just next door (at the corner) called Romanico Hotel also 4 star but looked much better and glamorous (and more expensive)! They share the bar and the SPA area. In Romanico hotel breakfast is served on the roof top, better area than the breakfast hall of Veneto Hotel. Hotel is located approximately 3 quarters from Via Veneto and about 7 minutes walking distance from metro Barberini and 10-15 minutes from Piazza Di Spagna. We enjoyed the tour of Rome all on foot!!! Quite tiring but enjoyable too!! Be careful! Colosseo, Roman forum and Paltino close at 15.30!! But they issue a ticket for you (12 euro) valid for 2 days. Also in case you need dinner make sure that this will be before 22.00-22.30. Most of restaurant close early.

Reviews.Title: “hotel policy & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Irene W
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints regarding the room we had, it was ok nothing special (basic for a Europe hotel). My complaints are regarding check out when we were charged 28 Euro for city tax (3 days) and it had to be paid in Euros. We weren't told of this additional fee until check out (lucky we had some Euros left). The breakfast 15 Euro for a coffee and toast had to be paid immediately (no hot dishes). We had the feeling the staff didn't like Americans because we heard the check in person offer the couple checking in upon our discharge free breakfast. We stayed at the hotel with our three sons and their companions. The hotel made the arrangements for our ride to the airport (the ride was 35min late) however the attendant called us a local cab which was cheaper and a fast ride. We just about made it in time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel veneto”
Reviews.Author: Deniseandalan
Reviews.Content: I have been reading reviews of the Hotel Veneto and I just can't believe some of the things people have. Said,my husband nd myself have been holidaying in the Veneto every year since 2004 and have never ever been disappointed the rooms are beautiful and clean,the staff polite and helpful we are oing again this year and every year in the future, and the reviewer who said 45minutes to the sights we are in our sixties and we can get to the sights in 20minutes,i

Reviews.Title: “great stay in hotel veneto”
Reviews.Author: tommcKilkennyIreland
Reviews.Content: we stayed in hotel veneto in october 2011 for 5 nights while getting married in rome. Before travelling I was worried after the reviews that were posted on tripadvisor about hotel veneto. We had booked a suite for 2 nights and were then planning on changing back to a standard double room. the reception staff upgraded us to the suite for the 5 nights, which we were delighted with., We had a great stay in hotel veneto. The room was spotless and the service in general was excellent. our guests at the wedding also had 5 double rooms booked in the veneto and all were delighted with their rooms and facilities. When we return to rome in the future we will stay in hotel veneto. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “booking mix up”
Reviews.Author: Roberto C
Reviews.Content: We had booked a double room so 4 of us could stay together. However, double rooms in europe are basically 2 twin beds. Giovanni went out of his way to get us an upgraded room to fit the 4 of us comfortably. Giovanni and all staff went out of their way during our stay to make sure we were well taken care of. For this, besides the hotel was beautiful and in a great location, I will return to Hotel Veneto next time we're in Rome. Thank you so much Giovanni.... Robert and Robin

Reviews.Title: “If horrible service, cold running water, and crappy rooms are your thing!”
Reviews.Author: Erika T
Reviews.Content: Honestly this was the worst hotel I have ever had to deal with They did not give me a room in the main hotel, they took me to some back ally apartment complex with a horrendous view of other peoples rooms and to top it off I only had cold water to take my showers in. When I called the front desk to have the issue addressed they sent a bell boy up who could not fix the problem, then after calling several times and still not having the issue resolved I wend down stairs in the morning and told the "manager" about my dilemma and he assured me they would send a plumber and that if my water was still cold he would give me a new better room. Well after touring Rome for the day and coming back to clean up I still had cold water, I called the front desk to ask for a new room he said that was not possible, I asked to speak with a manger and he said that was not possible, and then i asked for a partial refund for my troubles and he said that was not possible, he was rude and even hung up on me after telling me he would do nothing for me. I feel ripped off for the amount of money I paid for a so called "4" star hotel and the hotel was horrible and the service was even worse. To top it all off they changed my credit card 60 days before I even arrived in Rome so I could not dispute the charges on my credit card. This hotel ruined my vacation and my impression of how Italian hotels value there guests. I will never stay here again. they changed my credit card 60 days before I even arrived in Rome so I could not dispute the charges on my credit card. This hotel ruined my vacation and my impression of how Italian hotels value there guests. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: bmaDC
Reviews.Content: Four nights at Hotel Veneto in July. It was more modern Europe than we expected, but had all the comforts and luxury of any more traditional hotel in Rome. The location was perfect - a 10 minute walk from the subway, past lovely cafes and shops, and a 5 minute walk to the park. Our room was large and comfortable, with fabric-padded walls to give is a hushed, private feel. The bathroom was large, marble, and efficient. There was something weird with the shower water pooling on the ledge and creeping toward the floor, but the water was hot, and the tub luxurious. Wifi was easy to use. The rooftop bar was lovely. The front patio was a great spot to relax. Best part: a hospitality table in the lobby with chilled bubbly water and hot tea and coffee, available 24 hours a day. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service”
Reviews.Author: coolgregg1
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was great but thats where it ends. The second room were clean and adquate. I was never picked up at the airport like I had arranged. My first room was in bad need of repairs, the second room maintance had to come up to fix the tub. Could never get internet cards to work properly. Had to get my key card redone 3 times due to the door being messed up. Got bad directions 3 times from the front desk. refused to send anybody up to help my wife with the luggage, while I got the car. After going down to get my key card redone the third time and complaining about the service, the desk tried to buy me off with a cheap bottle of wine. I was stilled charged for the jaccuzzi in the first room even though it didn't work. This hotel needs a new staff thats communicates with in itself and the problems should be solved, but until then I wouldn't recomend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs in the room!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny M
Reviews.Content: It is not only that the hotel itself is not worthy of being called a 4 star hotel, it is the most disgusting and horrible place I ever stayed in. The first room we had to change because the room was barely big enough to move around in for two people. The second room on the top floor was bigger for sure but the air conditioner was not working properly. Since the room was on a sunny side, it got extremely hot there during the day. The worst part about it was that the hotel room we stayed in was infested with bed bugs! My friend woke up with red bites all over her body every morning. The staff said the hotel is full and they had no more rooms available. They said it must be mosquitos and dismissed our complaint. It was certainly not a mosquito, we have pictures of our bites that we keep just in case people don't believe us. The only thing we are concerned with is blood infections following and the fact that we might have brought them back home with us in our bags. Once they live in one room, they will eventually live in every room. I was horrified at the conditions and hope nobody else ever stays there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days last week (September) and was quite disappointed with this hotel. The hotel is located in a relatively convenient location however all the major sites are at least 45 minutes away by foot and the transport system in Rome is quite poor. This may not be too much of a problem in the cooler months but when the weather is hot ( most of the year) this is quite far. I found all the staff, apart from one lady at reception, to be abrupt and disinterested. On arrival, we were waiting for several minutes while they located out reservation (made by our travel agent) and were told that we had to pay €25 in cash immediately due to a taw by the city of Rome. This and the price of all the extras (WiFi €5 per hour) left a rather bitter taste in our mouth. By the time we got to our rather small room with absolutely no view we felt like we were getting taken for a ride. While we were being led to our room by the bellman (who we were not given a choice about , more money!) they had given us a key for the wrong room. We then walked in to the already occupied room on two rather shocked people who had been asleep in bed. No apology was offered (to us or the poor shocked people in the room) and it was seen as not a problem. It was also very hot while we were there and the air con in the room was quite ineffective. We had been told not to put the temperature below 18 degrees otherwise it would stop working. We did so and found that the room we more like 25 degrees. Unable to make it any cooler. There was also quite a serious leak in the bathroom, and following a five minute shower was protruding into the bedroom. We had to use all but one of our towels to stop it from covering the room. Staff did not respond to this problem in any way. We had paid for breakfast which was alright, but there was no fruit and the coffee was poor. I had just come from a three and a half star hotel in Paris following a very enjoyable stay. It was really very disappointing to come to this hotel, pay more and have such a negative experience. I travel quite frequently and have never left a negative review about a hotel before but this hotel was really very disappointing and I felt that we were charged for things that should come as standard, particularly in a four star hotel. This, for me, was not a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but rooftop breakfast not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: db8mommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week in room 526, which was a beautiful room. The bed and pillows were comfortable and the area of Rome is great - quiet but close enough to walk to the Metro without trouble. The restaurants that the staff suggested were some of the best meals of our trip. Breakfast was great and included in our room, but we were told that we would be charged extra to eat on the rooftop, something I was looking forward to very much. Awesome shower and bathroom. We would definately return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, ok location..but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: komodo8297
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights in the hotel over the long bank holiday weekend. When we arrived we were told that room in the main hotel will be available next day and meanwhile we were given room in the next door building. It meant we were unable to unpack. It wasn't very big deal as we came only for two nights, but still a little bit inconvenient. As we booked only room without the breakfast, we were given as the compensation for the inconvenience, two free breakfasts on the roof terrace. The next day we arrived at the reception early in the morning to check in in to the other room. We were under the impression that we will be given the room straight away. Unfortunately room was not ready until 14.00, so we left the luggage with the porter and went sightseeing. We were offered two complimentary welcome drinks in the bar, which we happily ordered after the whole day walking. As we stayed one night in the room next door to the hotel and one night in the main hotel, I can do some comparing. Both rooms were the same size, quite small but big enough if you do not plan to stay the whole day in the room. I have to admit that both were very clean, and I am a clean freak. We had good size and very comfortable bed in the first room, unfortunately I cannot say the same thing about the second room. Bed was smaller and as I turned over the whole bed always moved a bit as it was on wheels. Decor of the both rooms was not up to my taste at all, but it is a personal thing. Furniture was gold and with over the top decorations. A/C worked perfectly in both rooms, which was very important as the weather was too hot. We had a shower door missing in the main hotel room. There was only the door frame left were used to be a shower door, so it was replaced by the simple shower curtain. Showers were very powerful and fancy in both rooms, even had a shower jets for a massage. Unfortunately we were unable to use it in the second room. As soon as we turned it on, it blew the curtain away and whole bathroom got flooded. I am an average person and showers were too small to even turn around. There was also a make up mirror hanging of the wall with the electric wire exposed and broken floor lamp. For all these little details I just mentioned I would not give a four stars to this hotel. On the positive note: hotel was very quite and we did not experience any noise in the corridors or other rooms. Breakfast was really tasty, buffet style, enough choice. Fruit, yoghurts, cereals, ham, salami, cheese, vegetables, even selection of cakes. Great start of the day on the roof terrace. All hotel staff was really helpful and polite. Hotel is about 10 minutes walk from metro station. Would I stay here again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service. Not Worth Staying Here.”
Reviews.Author: George T
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel Veneto was terrible. Some of the pictures they are showing on the website are of the hotel Romantico which is the hotel that is adjoined to the hotel Veneto. We were in Rome for four days and any information we needed, we went to the hotel next to us to get help. At the hotel Veneto their is no concierge and the staff was not helpful at all. They also charge an unexpected fee which is not mentioned per person per night. The person that checked us in said that it had to be paid in cash and that we couldn't add it to our bill. It just seemed like a scam, because they wouldn't even give a receipt. Overall I would highly NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to leave”
Reviews.Author: LeRegardEloigne
Reviews.Content: We belonged to those guests, that were brought to the entrance around the corner and had breakfast in a hall on the ground floor. We felt strange between the tasteless furniture, and the bottles of champagne you find everywhere as decoration. Maybe this should give the guest the feeling to be in a distinguished place but I haven't seen this in the 5-star hotels I've stayed before. W-Lan in the room is 20 Euro per day. Ok, the room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good, wide choice of tea, cake, granola, etc., but coffee from the dispenser is a little disappointing for Italy. Maybe they bring you an espresso for an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel?!?”
Reviews.Author: hkchick84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August and find it hard to believe that this is a 4 star hotel. We are not fussy hotel stayers, but found this hotel well below a 4 star hotel. When we arrived we were taken outside and around the corner to an old apartment building, and then shown up to our room which was not part of the actual hotel. The room was quite nice, had air-con and large bed but looked badly finished, (doors not aligned with the walls, paint over the bathroom etc). Room ammenities were not good for 4 star, 'cable't v consisted of 2 English channels and the bathroom only had soap and shower caps. There was no free wi-fi, so we bought a wi-fi card, it did not work in our room only in the lobby. Continental breakfast was okay, but had to pay 7 Euros for a small plate of bacon and eggs. Hotel looks old and scuffed, dirty marks on the walls everywhere. Location is not great, not really near any main attractions. The road the hotel is on has nothing but other hotels and some residential buildings. The website of the hotel is very well done and does not reflect what the hotel actually looks like. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel and I would recommend choosing another hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overall ok...but 4 star??”
Reviews.Author: Traveller63Norsk
Reviews.Content: Got a relatively good price on Hotels.com and stayed three nights the last week in July. It is close to the American embassy the via veneto being just a few blocks away. The 910 local city bus that leaves right outside the main train station stops literally at the doorstep of the hotel, 5 minutes, one euro... That was a big plus. You can walk to the spanish steps in 15 minutes. The room was ok sized and the bathrrom adequate. The furnishings where old fashion which can be seen as either quaint or slightly run down... perhaps a bit past former glory but we enjoyed it. We were asked if we wanted an upgrade on arrival but neither the room nor the breakfast seemed worth it so we stayed where we were. We started each day in a cofee shop on the street behind the hotel where we got great cappuchino at local prices :) Used the Gym one morning and it was good. There is a Spar supermarket two blocks away open until 9pm. Otherwise not to much open nearby late in the evening. The main guy at the front desk was quite aloof and I can't say particularly helpful. For what it is and the price we would stay here again and I would recommend it but when I go back to Rome(which was just beautiful) I may try to get something a bit closer to the attractions as such now that I am more familiar with the city. We got around fine walking and using the metro and buses which are very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - ask for a room with an outdoor jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: KateLondon_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Veneto some time ago and meant to write a review as I really loved it here. I was suprised that the other reviews on Tripadvisor were mixed. The hotel had lots of charm and the rooms were decorated so wonderfully. Really luxurious. I don't know if we had an upgraded room - the man on reception didn't specifically mention it - but our room was huge - we had a bedroom, a small room through to the bathroom with a dressing table and small sofa, then we had a good sized bathroom which led out to an outdoor jacuzzi (Room 601). The jacuzzi really was the highlight of the room. No one could see you but you could have a jacuzzi and look up into the sky. It was brilliant! The breakfast was good too - pastries etc, but you had to pay for for hot food, which wasn't a problem as we ate so much for dinner and lunch in all the lovely restaurants in Rome. I would definitely stay here again and request the same room again, as it seems from other reviews that most rooms are smaller and ceratinly don't all come with the fabulous outdoor jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Ungracious hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MoMo60
Reviews.Content: This was the most expensive place we two couples stayed during our two weeks in Italy and Sicily - and the least enjoyable. When we arrived, the porter grabbed our bags, although we were clearly managing just fine on our own, so that we would have to tip him. Then the desk clerk announced unceremoniously that the city was now charging a hotel tax that we had to pay immediately, in cash. With a bad taste in our mouths, we proceeded to our tiny rooms which were overfilled with outsized, ersatz gilded furniture. During out two-night stay, we discovered that the hotel charged extra for everything: in-room wi-fi; breakfast (the only hotel of seven we stayed in that did not provide it); use of the lobby computer; local phone calls; and a surcharge on the airport shuttle. No complaints about the hotel's cleanliness or location ( we came for the Mille Miglia), but we felt relieved when we left.

Reviews.Title: “An older hotel in excellent condition.”
Reviews.Author: nekeyah
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The hotel had real charm and was clean and quiet. The room was well sized and comfortable having been recently renovated. Also, they were able to supply gluten free products at breakfast. The staff was efficient and friendly. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: takethat6573
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a saturday evening and were greeted by a very friendly and helpful receptionist. Our room was really nice, tradionally decorated and very clean, we could smell the washing powder on the bed linen, most unusual for a hotel!!! we were in a very good location and were at some of the main attractions within 15mins walk. I wouldnt recommend going in july as the weather was very hot (38 degrees). We had breakfast on the roof terrace with beautiful views all arround. Could have been a little more choice at breakfast but perfectly edible. Rome itself was stunning, romantic,busy and very expensive. will definately be coming back and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice room on the 6th floor around from the main hotel area”
Reviews.Author: shook1946
Reviews.Content: We really liked our room and being on the 6th floor we had a nice view of the city. The Veneto Hotel operates another section just around the corner from their main hotel. Access to this area was through a large door. The elevator was very old and at first a bit scary for us to use. My husband loved the uniqueness of it and enjoyed this area. The room was small but very nice with a comfortable bed, great air conditioning, and a very nice bathroom and large shower with lots of optional shower settings. The breakfast room was in the main hotel on the 7th floor. It was very nice with a fantastic view of the city. We walked everywhere we went so besides getting some great exercise we were able to walk to all the sights very easily. We did take one bus tour to the Vatican City for sights in that area. We'd stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vbiter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. On arrival we were offered an upgrade to a junior suite for an additional €25 per night but after comparing the rooms and the view from the windows we opted to stay with the standard room. This was on the sixth floor, on street side of the hotel, and had good views of the Rome skyline including the dome of Saint Peter’s in the distance. I was a bit apprehensive about staying at the Veneto in light of some of the negative comments I read on Trip Advisor but in the event I was very pleasantly surprised at what we found. The hotel is in a good location, not too far from Termini railway station and the Metro and within reasonable walking distance of several major tourist sites. The room was clean with regularly replaced towels and bed linen and the bathroom was great. Breakfast was good and I found the staff helpful and friendly but the hotel bar is expensive. We would certainly stay there again. One point to note: We booked through easytobook.com and despite our Booking Confirmation document saying that City Tax was included in the overall price, when we checked out we had to pay an additional €42 for City Taxes, in cash, to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic room. Poor location in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: Wavebat
Reviews.Content: Cute boutique hotel. Location was a bit far for us. In fancy shopping/dining district, kind of up a gradual hill, so getting to colosseum, vatican, Pantheon was a bit of a walk. OK at 1st, but towards the end of our trip, we were getting tired. Close to dining on Veneto street though, so that was appreciated. Close to Borghese gallery (just an ok site to visit). Breakfast- continental. No hair conditioner. Nice shower. Internet for small fee. Buy as you go. Has laundry, just make sure to check up on it the next day (misplaced my laundry, but they found it eventually). Had to pay a "city fee" of additional about ~ $8 euros/night?Not sure what that was all about. Rooms- cutely decorated. Nice bar downstairs to have a nightcap. If you need anything, talk to blond woman-very on top of it and speaks English the best! I probably would have stayed near Pantheon or Spanish Steps next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: camarilloroberts
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, average hotel. The rooms were clean. The breakfast was very good. It was situated close to public transportation. The service was good. We enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, though small rooms and not an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: EP99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2011. While it is in a fairly central part of Rome, it is not nearly as central to many of the tourist sites as it looks on the map. I don't mind walking, but it was often pretty long walks to get anywhere, and there's barely a subway in the old part of Rome. During the summer months, this might be a great location. For one thing, it is very close to the park, so if you want to run, etc. you are in a great spot. Also, in the summer, walking 35 minutes to get to places like Piazza Navona isn't a big deal at all. During the winter, it is a bigger deal because of the rain, etc. Also, during the summer being away from the worst of the crowds might be a nice thing. Overall, though, the Via Veneto hasn't been the place to be since the 1970s. Rooms are nicely decorated. They are a small though, even by European standards (the smallest we saw in all of Italy). The walls to the hallway are very thin, meaning that hallway noise comes into your room unfortunately. Breakfast was good. They have a great espresso bar where they can make you cappuccinos etc. too and a pretty good selection of fruits and pastries. Unfortunately they charge you quite a bit to even get poorly made eggs. The view from the breakfast room is quite nice. If you are interested in wireless, you'll probably be disappointed to see how much they charge. Everywhere else in Italy had either free wireless or very cheap wireless. It was enough at Hotel Veneto that it wasn't worth paying for. Despite some of the negatives, it is still a nicely decorated, clean hotel with pleasant staff, and I wouldn't have a problem staying here again if the price was right,

Reviews.Title: “Better than average stay”
Reviews.Author: Bubblebeard
Reviews.Content: I'd booked the hotel as a surprise birthday present for my partner; a chance to explore a city I have repeatedly fallen in love with. The hotel photos made the hotel look elegant and romantic. Reality did not quite hold up to this expectation, but was still an enjoyable experience. Our room was comfortable and fairly clean. We had a fairly odd four poster double bed, without a canopy. The pillars were a bit old and very dusty, and combined with the fading hand-painting on the wall made the room seem dated rather than antique. Exploring the halls, I had the impression that renovations on the hotel and room hadn't quite reached our floor but this was just an assumption. The bathroom was very new and fantastic; a great shower and bath with spa options. Staff were efficient if not out-and-out friendly, and the breakfast was varied if not of a great quality. All in all we still found romance in the hotel. The hotel is fantastically situated and a perfect base to explore the city; a city whose charm has no choice but to permeate into the Hotel Veneto. For the price we paid, I am not complaining at all, and would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: rcjcough
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights in early May at this hotel. The location is great and within walking distance to all of the major sites. The room was on the small side but clean and maintained. The breakfast was fine with a decent assortment of food. Rome was fabulous with so many wonderful things to see and do, we could have stayed longer. The tours of the major sited were very informative and allowed you to skip the long lines if done on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Good,comfortable hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: PM22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Rome from April 21st to 23rd 2011, and we spent our holiday at the Veneto Palace Hotel. This hotel is in a good area (10 min walk from the main railway station) and provides comfortable rooms and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A very negative experience. Had to change hotels.”
Reviews.Author: katerfarrington
Reviews.Content: We are family of four and had two rooms. There were no windows in the room. One of the rooms had an awful smell, as if something had died under the bed. We tried twice to get the hotel staff to remedy the situation to no avail. We ended up piling into one room. The breakfast was very mediocre. Many of the platters/bowls of food at the buffet were empty and never replenished. We got very little to eat. When we mentioned the awful smell again to the man and women at check out they were unapologetic. We had to switch hotels. Truly a terrible experience. We felt as though they just wanted to take our money and give us nothing in return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great service but kind of noisy”
Reviews.Author: priscillaka
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is really good. The service at the reception desk, bar and breakfast restaurant were great. They are friendly and courteous. The housekeeping service was also fantastic. Every time we came back to the room at night, it was clean with fresh towels and smelled good too. My only complaint is the very loud noise from the other rooms pluming as well as our neighbors talking in the morning. The room decor is beautiful with good lighting and charming details throughout the bathrooms too. Breakfast was excellent. It takes place at the rooftop floor with gorgeous views of the city. The food was delicious! We really liked this hotel, the location was quiet and close to Via Veneto but still a little walk to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Mara_pt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Veneto Hotel last year and i was pleased with it, the room was small but since i didn't spend that much time in the room, the size really didn't matter to me, it was clean and for me that's what matter. The price was quite reasonable and the hotel offered the tickets for the Colosseum and Roman forum, plus airport trans. Breakfast service was ok, nothing special. They don't have a restaurant in the hotel but there is one right next door, also Hard Rock Cafe's in walking distance. Ok hotel if all you need is a place to sleep while enjoying Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small Dirty Room with Uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: roycinus
Reviews.Content: Pro: 1. Price: Reasonable price. I paid $115+tax. However, for the same price, the Romanico Palace right next to Veneto has better room. They are owned by the same company though. 2. Free Breakfast (nothing special, just bread, cake, juice and coffee) 3. Area is quiet and safe. Con: 1. Room is very small and dirty. My room was right next to the elevator. I can barely sleep at night. 2. No bath, just shower. 3. No free internet. 5 Euro/hr or 10 Euro/3 hrs. Internet is slow. 4. Poor location. 15 minutes uphill walk from metro. Take bus 52 53 or 63 instead. 5. The double bed is just two combined single bed. Too short and small for Americans. 6. Small TV 7. Strict Check in check out policy. 11AM checkout, 2PM Checkout. Early Checking 25euro, late checkout 45euro. They do have free luggage storage. Conclusion: Definitely not a 4 stars hotel. More like a 3 stars in Europe standard or a 2 stars in US standard. This is one of the Priceline Hotel in Rome. Check the price online before you place a bid.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of behind the times a bit”
Reviews.Author: Suzip7894
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel was wonderful. The lobby and bar area were very luxurious looking. The room itself was pretty small. Everything was blue and painted to look antique. The tv was tiny. It was okay, not too bad. The water pressure was pretty low, and we had to run the hot water in the sink while taking a shower to get any hot water in the shower. The room was cleaned very well each day on a good note. The "standard double" room had one platform with two twin mattresses pushed together as a bed. At the front desk, to get wifi, you had to purchase 1 hour (3 euro) or 3 hours (5 euro) which actually wasn't bad compared to a lot of places. but they had you sign a sheet and they cut a piece of paper off of it with the login and password to use (you could sign out so that you could use the rest later) it was a bit old school i guess. but overall it was pretty nice. the location was good, about 5 minute walk from a main square (Barbarini) which had the metro there. There wasnt a restaurant in the hotel, only a bar. They used a different restaurant for breakfast but for lunch and dinner you were on your own. Overall decent, but a little outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and Location, but Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ecojojo81
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Veneto twice now, which I guess shows that it is pretty good. It actually could be quite great - close to tourist areas, cheap, nice and clean, but it is noisy. Maybe we were unlucky this time with our room, but I felt like I was sleeping in the maid's quarters - it was loud from early in the morning. If you ask for a room away from this then it should be fine. It is a good place that I'd recommend, but just be warned you might need ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovecities89
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights last August...and it was lovely.... were upgraded to a bigger room when we checked in (randomly)..... and the room was massive big bath....but to be honest i didnt travel to Rome to have a long bath and lay in bed for my whole trip!!s So the size of the room of the staff at the hotel didnt bother me...the location was perfect, my partner and i walked to ALL of the tourist attractions from the hotel...the breakfast was a little basic...but again why sit in your hotel for breakfast when your staying in Rome!!!!!!Get out and explore!!!! Some of these moany reviews seem very fussy to me!!! We had a great time and the very little time we were in our room was great!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: carolineblack87
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very unhelpful. Hotel building work stated at 8am! Very basic Breakfast. Uncomfortable beds- two singles pushed together! Broken balcony door. Good location is all thats in the hotels favour!

Reviews.Title: “The vacation of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlie1
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room was small, but it's Rome and these buildings have been around for a very long time. The room was very clean (and I am really picky). The bathroom was large, but the shower was small (this is not unusual for Europe). We were there for New Years Eve and expected some type of partying and disturbance, but was pleasantly surprised when it was quiet. There is a great area on the ground floor to hang out and people watch out the windows. In the evening there is a bar tender and he is very nice. In fact, we found the staff to be very helpful. The cleaning staff is fantastic. The hotel is in a safe quiet area. It is a long walk to the Vatican, but everything else seemed in reasonable distance. It's been a long time since I stayed at a hotel and had someone take my luggage out of my hands and close car doors for me (quite a treat!). We did hire a driver to and from the airport. The breakfast is expensive. There are wonderful cafe's right next to the hotel. The local restaurants are fantastic. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: traveler990000
Reviews.Content: The location is decent, but other than that, you can do much better in Rome for a 4 star hotel. The hotel is tired and not the cleanest. The staff is dismissive and surly. I felt as if we were inconveniencing them when we asked questions. They will charge you for everything imaginable.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic mother and daughter bonding trip!!”
Reviews.Author: ethey
Reviews.Content: I am a 53year old mother who had a great trip with her 25year old daughter ,we had a fantastic time .We arrived at 9am Monday morning and left the hotel late afternoon Thursday.All the time we were there we walked everywhere ,we saw ruins,Churchs and shopped for england.This was my forth visit ,ems first ,she fell in love with the history and the beauty of it all as i did on my first visit.The hotel could not have been better placed,staff were just great ,on our return everyday a cup of coffee would arrive in the bar with the warmest of smiles to greet us.St Peters church and the chapel were worth paying for to have the tour, learn t so much more than doing it ourselves need i say more....go visit.....so much to see ,food fantastic ,cannot wait to return. teri baston

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dbesgbeg
Reviews.Content: I felt that the administrative staff were not very tolerant and somewhat surly with our lack of spoken Italian. I thought it was costly (>$200) for a small, interior unimaginative room--many problems with the air conditioning. When I called for some ice, I was curtly told that it would cost 10 Euros (about $15 dollars). Great location. Serving staff friendly. RH

Reviews.Title: “No Double Beds”
Reviews.Author: andy1bell
Reviews.Content: My superior double room was two singles pushed together. I asked to change to a room with a double bed and was told that ALL the rooms were the same! For one of the most romantic cities in the world I think this is ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Travelcrazy92
Reviews.Content: I found this Hotel through Trip Advisor and booked it through the hotels website. it was very reasonably priced and we got a great package that came with wine, chocolate strawberries and a five course dinner plus the room for nights for the price of one night a popular american chain hotels. The hotel was very Boutique which we love! It played in to the Romance of an Italian honeymoon and the dinner we had was one of the best of our trip. The staff was great. The beds are kinda flat but we loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mommy3z
Reviews.Content: Room was small but what we expected. Very clean, well stocked and neat. Location a little far from popular sites but we didn't mind bus stop right in front of hotel and still walking distant to most places. We probably walked the whole city wasn't that big. Very quiet in the evening. Breakfast buffet had tons of choices (same thing everyday though). Very friendly and helpful staff. Paid 105 Euro a night for 3 people. Amazing deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with zero customer service”
Reviews.Author: Vega25London
Reviews.Content: It seems the staff at this hotel have never been given any customer service training. They tend to say "Yes" to everything but there's no action after that. They are very hassled when you ask for any advice or recomendations. Not at all helpful, we carried our own luggage in & out of the hotel. We ordered ice from room service on the first evening, it hadn't turned up even when we left after 4 days! Look through other hotels as this hotel does not offer the value you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JaD65
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and friendly and the 2 rooms we booked were close to each other. Our rooms were next door to the main entrance but were connected to the main bldg. Almost like having your own apartment. (only 3 rooms on our floor). The bar/restaurant on the 7th floor was very good and the staff were very friendly. Cafe/bars and restaurants all around. We walked to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon and the Vatican on Wednesday and made it on time to see the Pope. Be sure to check with the main desk to see if you will be having breakfast on the 7th floor (good view) or on the main floor.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place close to Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: RDMWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: I tried to find a hotel near the Spanish Steps in Rome. I had been in the area before and it's what I was looking for traveling with my young daughter. Check-in was quick and simple. When I checked in they were quick to tell me that a deluxe room had just opened up for an extra 15 euro per night. I probably fell in to it but the room was more than comfortable than regular European standards. The bathroom as the bed were large enough to feel at ease. We had a nice view to the front of the street. This is the only hotel that I have stayed at that had plenty of electrical outlets, I did not need to unplug anything in the room. Wi-Fi is available with good speed and good reception through the hotel at a rate of 20 per day or less for 3 or 1 hour packages. The hotel was nothing special other than the fact that you were minutes from the Via Veneto and at a fraction of the cost; The hotel has to working elevators, a European breakfast room (coffee, cereal, bread, cold cuts, etc) and a restaurant that we did not visit. My only complaint of the hotel was that I was offered to have my bag taken to the room and after 30 minutes of waiting I decided to fetch it myself.. All I got was "Sorry we are busy" Lame response since you did offer to take my bag to the room. The hotel is very clean as is the neighborhood. Another issue for some might be the fact that the doors are hollow and you can here people talking as they walk by. Only local channels available with CNN as the only English channel. working A/C is welcome plus! A restaurant as a coffee bar are right next to the hotel and Via Veneto a short 5 minute walk. The Spanish steps a good 15-20 minute depending on your pace. All in All a nice clean place with no bells or whistles that has the ideal function: a Clean bed with a clean shower to stay rested and fresh to visit a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Romanesque”
Reviews.Author: DisastrousDelicious
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel looking like two very poor and down trodden backpackers (soaked in the rain after an exhausting journey) but the hotel staff were ever so friendly - instantly helping us with our bags and arranging an early check-in so we could refresh before heading into the city. The room has this 'wow' factor to it. Very clean and quite spacious. A comfy bed and chase lounge ... perfect after a long day of sightseeing. My boyfriend had planned to propose to me at the Trevi Fountain, but found the room to be just as romantic (and much less crowded) so popped the question there :) A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amazing amazing”
Reviews.Author: newcastle74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. location is lovely and quiet. the via veneto with its beautiful resteraunts is simply 5 mins walk away. centre of rome 15 mins walk. The room was a nice size and quiet. the staff were very helpful with airport arrangements, resteraunt advice and general help. Breakfast was delicious with pastries. bread. fruit and meats and cheeses. I recommend the cesarina resteraunt along the street. the food is amazing. i will definately be coming back to the veneto again-

Reviews.Title: “confused about hotel”
Reviews.Author: fran54_10
Reviews.Content: Myself my husband and our teenage son stayed here for a week. We chose this hotel for its location to most of the sites that the tourist wants to visit. The rooms we had were nice both with en-suites, we were given lovely clean fresh towels everyday, and the beds were nicely made too every day, the complaints that i'd have is the lack of extra pillows "unlike other hotels we stayed in", no tea or coffee making facility, and our long window didn't really close properly letting in some street noise especially in the early morning. One thing to be aware of is : the extra charge for requesting someone to check out the minibar which didn't work properly, as we noted on our receipt after checkout. The breakfast was served downstairs, contrary to the fact that it stated on the net it would be on the terrace . A final point to note is, that it is possible to walk from one hotel to the other hotel"via reception" , which is the only part of the hotel which has access to the terrace, it seems like this hotel acts as an overspill for the one we stayed in while being under a different name, sorry if this last paragraph sounds confusing but thats how we felt too :-) Hope this review is of some help.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Veneto”
Reviews.Author: greenv09
Reviews.Content: I'm a travel agent and lead a small group to Italy and Greece. While in Rome we stayed at the Hotel Veneto. The friendly and professional staff, nice rooms, and beautiful breakfast room added to our enjoyable visit to the city. The hotel assisted me in dining reservations too. I would highly recommend the room my husband and I had, room 601. It has a wonderful outdoor jacuzzi/tub that was an added treat. All our rooms were very clean and a good value. We definitely send clients here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: 187791Italyfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a two and a half week tour of Italy so I did not pay a great deal of attention to choosing a hotel. When we arrived we thought the rooms were absolutely lovely. The decor and comfort was to a very high standard and the value was excellent. It was also a good location. We were allowed to have our rooms early (we arrived around 12 lunchtime) too. We then accidentally left a digital camera behind. The hotel immediately located it, packed it all up for the courier and I had it back in England within 24 hours. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: hobbes40
Reviews.Content: We arrived from an overnight flight and asked if we could check in early. Not only did the gentleman at the reception desk say 'yes,' but he gave us an upgrade, because our rooms were not ready. Instead of receiving 2 doubles, we were given 1 double and a suite with a queen in the bedroom and another queen in the living room, which was perfect because we were in fact a group of 3 and 1. Breakfast was also included, all for an amazingly low price. There was free wi-fi. The signal was a bit weak, but we were pleased nonetheless. The location was so-so: close to some lovely high-end shops but little night-life. There is a bus which drops you off close to the hotel, but the bus runs infrequently in the evening. The better option is a subway stop. It's perhaps a 10-min. walk (tops).

Reviews.Title: “Great for runners and those whom prefer rooms with down comforters and air-conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: gastrophilejoe
Reviews.Content: I was not initially satisfied with my room but the manager was more than willing to work things out with me. He allowed me and my wife to look at each of the available rooms and pick whichever one best suited our needs for our weeklong stay! The concierge was also extrememly knowledgeable and helpful with providing recommendations and directions. The breakfast was basic but very pleasant: espresso, cappuccino, fresh fruit, pastries, toast, deli meats, cheese, cereal. If you stay here you MUST MUST MUST got to the nearby Pizzeria Al Forno Della Soffitta and Gelateria I Caruso (hands down best quality, best taste, best prices, friendliest atmosphere)!!! We specifically chose this hotel for the down comforters, the air-conditioning, and its short distance to the Borghese Park (several great dirt running trails). We were extremely satisfied and, even though it's a sweaty 15 minute walk to city center, we'd still do it all over again. Maybe not a 5-rating for everyone, but it suited our needs better than expected. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kayem26
Reviews.Content: A splendid hotel in the heart fo Rome. Close to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi fountain, Colosseum. A lovely short walk into the centre. The room was a good size, air conditioned and available to set the temperature to the level you want. Good sized bathroom and great power shower. Hotel staff all very helpful, polite welcoming and went out of their way to help. The roof terrace with bar offers amazing views over Rome. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkoondel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and would stay there again. Good location. Wonderful staff and most helpful. I would certainly recommend this hotel when going to Rome. A special thanks to Maria and Jacqueline for all your helping us find our way around your wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JLW2010
Reviews.Content: This was the third and last hotel my husband and I stayed at during our honeymoon in Italy and our least favorite. The hotel staff was not very attentive, friendly or helpful and none of them had any sense of urgency. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation, the guy seemed dumbfounded and only had one suggestion. However, he did manage to recommend a good place. We were offered an upgrade to a room with a 'jacuzzi' for 25 euro, which was laughable. It is hardly wide enough to fit one person who is stick-thin. We did not have any issues with noise. The beds weren't the most comfortable. We were very disappointed with the breakfast buffet. It consisted of the same food as the other hotels we stayed at in Italy, but the food was not good, so we only ate there on our first morning. And beware of their 'coffee.' It had a burnt taste, so bad I couldn't finish one cup. We were given complementary drinks at their bar for being honeymooners, but we were very disappointed to find out it only covered wine, soda, or beer! The location was not the greatest. An easy walk from the train station, however if you are not going to stay in the middle of Rome, try getting a hotel that is closer to a subway stop. The closet stop is almost half way to the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best deal in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nyctoric
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the one night after our cruise and before our flight home. At $110/night each for two rooms this was a fantastic buy. Gianni at the front desk was incredibly helpful especially given the busy nature of this hotel. Our rooms ended up being in "the residence", an annex to the hotel just a few steps around the corner. The rooms were large by European standards, clean, well air-conditioned, and very nicely appointed. My wife flipped over the place. Breakfast is provided in their beautiful rooftop area with panoramic views of the city. A real treat. If you're comfortable with public transportation the location works out well for the money. There is a bus stop right out front with several buses that bring you to Termini station where you can transfer to anywhere. Metro stations are less than a 20 minute walk. There aren't a whole lot of restaurants in the area, but a short walk up Via Boncompagni or a little further to Via Bergamo should provide some great choices.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Whodem
Reviews.Content: Arrived the day ownership of the hotel was changing. New owners worked extremely hard to make our stay delightful. Some hiccups due to the changeover but as a whole, the 5 night stay was great. Location ideal. Very clean. Hard working new owners. Highly recommed as a 3 star hotel. Had everything we needed or wanted. Breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not 4 star but very pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: AnnalottaK
Reviews.Content: We booked an online offer which included a free upgrade to a room with hydromassage bathtub (+ airport transfer and a bottle of wine in the room). We arrived some three hours before check-in time but were given a warm-hearted welcome and a map over places of interest. Coming back three hours later, tired and warm, we were given the key to our room. We walked into the room, which felt less than welcoming, to find a small bathroom with a shower crammed in one corner. The bathtub was important to me as it was my 40th birthday and I love bathing but we don´t have a bathtub at home. We went straight back to the front desk and after having read some reviews earlier, I was dreading we´d have to pay extra - or accept that horrid room. Two minutes later, I was called to the front desk, given an excuse and a key to a completely different room on the second floor, WITH a bathtub. Yes, this hotel has its flaws - chipped marble and paint, a crack in the wall, the installations in the bathroom seems to have been made by a five-year-old, we couldn´t get the massage shower to work - but I loved it!! If I had paid the prices stated at the front desk I would have been outraged, but I paid 158 euros per night and I have NO complaints. The bed was very comfortable, if a little short for my tall fiance, and it was a proper double, not two singles pushed together. It was properly made and clean towels supplied every day. Loud traffic from early morning to late evening - be sure to pack your earplugs. Breakfast was quite OK, you can easily keep your belly full until lunch - though I normally don´t eat pastries and pies for breakfast. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly and the scent in the lobby is welcoming and lovely. We are proud to announce we were their first guests in the hotel spa. It clearly has potential, the steam sauna is beautiful and the mood showers quite nice, if a little cold. As soon as they change the music (disco music is not very relaxing) and get the dressing rooms ready, this spa will be great. Rome is a very expensive city but if we do return, I will most probably stay at the hotel Veneto again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to return - soon, please!”
Reviews.Author: Lizcat
Reviews.Content: My partner & I have just come back from a stay here and thoroughly enjoyed it. I booked with the hotel direct in February and had a package that included tickets for the Coliseum/Forum and these were waiting for us on arrival. We were met at the airport by a very pleasant driver who pointed out various landmarks on the way to the hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful during our time there, exceptionally efficient and very smartly turned out. They were all a credit to the hotel. The room was decorated in a flambouyant way but we loved it. The bed was very comfortable and the room was pristine in its cleanliness. The only complaint we would have was that we could only get CNN as an English TV station so missed the news morning and night - BBC news would have been better for us but that's just us being picky as you don't come to Rome to watch telly after all. Breakfast was fantastic with a great selection of cereals, meats, cheeses, bread buns, fruit, yoghurt, cakes and pastries. Never ending supply of tea/coffee/juice/water and staff would make you a cappucino, latte or whatever if you asked - it was no problem. The staff kept all the food and drink topped up and tables were cleared efficiently. We paid to go up to have breakfast on the roof top terrace one day - 5 euros extra but well worth it on a nice day. We found a nice restaurant 'Il Pomidorino' a short distance away where the staff were again great and the food was very pleasant - fills with locals which I always take as a good sign. It wasn't cheap but was certainly reasonable for Rome and the steak and other meats were good portions. I can also recommend 'Lotti' for ice-cream and cakes on via Sardagna nearby. The hotel's location was very good and a short walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and such like. The Coliseum etc,etc are also within walking distance. I have bad joints and managed to stroll everywhere. Rome is a very, very expensive city - £4/£5 for a tea or coffee is standard and a basic pasta lunch of 2 dishes with 2 drinks like coke or water doesn't leave you any change from £25. It was certainly a lot more expensive than when I had been before, although some of that will be due to the pound/euro rate. Tip - take a travel kettle with you wherever you stay for those night-time/early morning brews ! I would definitely stay at this hotel again without hesitation and hope that this will be possible on a return visit before too long as I want to take my mum back.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely unprofessional. Overbooking a standard practice.”
Reviews.Author: Alxx
Reviews.Content: Having booked a room almost a month in advance and having received two confirmation emails (the second only two days before my check in date) and also having informed the hotel that I will arrive around 11pm I was in a shock when I arrived there after 20 hours in planes and airports and I was informed that they had no room for me.... I should have listened to the other tripadvisor reviewers... The guy at the reception kept saying "I don't know, I just got here..." Of course they offered to send me to another hotel but first asked me to pay in advance. When I denied they said that they will charge my credit card anyway... I told them that since they have my credit card information for guarantee they should wait for me to make the payment the following morning when I check-out. When I did go to check out all the transactions were already done...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Clean Hotel with lovely interior. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Honest_Joe87
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome just before Christmas (flew back x-mas eve) for a long weekend break. We stayed at the Veneto Roma, on arrival i was taken aback of how friendly and helpful the staff were. The rooms were cleaned daily by cleaners that seemed trustworthy. But if you have trust issues they do provide you with a free safe which came in handy and we left all our valuables in there. The room and bathroom itself was very clean and i personally loved the elegant interior. The bathroom had a excellent power shower! We went on a bed and breakfast basis, and every morning we has breakfast on the top balcony terrace over looking the surrounding area. The breakfast itself was a classic continental breakfast with fresh orange juice, selection of meats, pastries, cereals and hot drinks. If there was a specific drink you would like personally made i.e. a latte or mocha, the staff were more than happy to make it for you. I dont know why people are saying anything bad about the place, we personally loved it and In a nutshell we would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading website, definetly not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyFanatic_10
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by the Hotel Veneto. When making our reservation through last minute, two free tickets to the colosseum were advertised. However on arrival staff told us this was only when a delux room was booked which was not made clear on the advert. This was also brought up by another customer at reception before us. After complaining about this the hotel staff offered to upgrade our room as a gesture of goodwill and offered us two complimentary drinks. However when we arrived in our room it did not look anything like the pictures advertised on the website. The room was tiny with a small window and a view that consisted of 3 outside walls. If ours was a delux a room I dread to think what a standard room was like. The 'double' bed was made up of two single beds pushed together and the bathroom was like a closet. When we also claimed our free drinks we were overcharged for others we purchased. After ordering three glasses of wine and a glass of amaretto the total bill came to 28 euros. When we produced our free drinks card the waiter minused 10 euros for two glasses of wine which meant that one glass of wine and a glass of amaretto came to 18 euros. If one glass of wine is 5 euros then thats the most expensive amaretto drink I have ever had in my life! complete rip off. The reception staff were unfriendly and unhelpful, not once did they make me feel like a valued guest. From their responses to other negative reviews I can also see that it appears that the guest always appears to be at fault which from my experience I can probably guess that is not the case. The only positives were the hotels cleanliness and one of the porters managed a smile whilst we were there. If you are looking for good value for money and a quality 4 star hotel I would recommend to avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Look on the bright side”
Reviews.Author: maimeeLondon
Reviews.Content: location - good, in a nice clean part of Rome, it felt safe to walk about at night and it was close to the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. lots of little places to eat around (not too expensive if you look down the side-streets) the best we found (a little more expensive, but actually around what you would pay for a good meal in London) was in the Spagna area. a little place called 'Margutta ristorarte' really lovely. room - very clean, fresh towels and sheets everyday - couldn't complain on that front. HOWEVER we did book a 'sperior double' which we paid extra for and were left dissapointed. it was very small and the only superior thing about it, which we were told by reception upon complaint, was that it had a whirlpool shower which made it superior. we also would not have expected our view to be of the air conditioning unit and nothing else. that said, everything else was fine. oh and the t.v only had one english chanel - bbc world news! again....not such an issue if you don't spend lotsof time in the room. staff - very nice and friendly. spoke good English and seemed genuinely happy to help with anything. breakfast - no toaster, just a sandwich toaster which took FOREVER - this may seem like a minor complaint - and it is - but it annoyed us. everything else was fine, what you would expect. bar - very expensive . cocktails were 10 euros each ......... but did have ALOT of alcohol in them....so maybe worth it. when i lost my bag (from being too drunk from said cocktails) the staff were very helpful in helping us find it again! all in all it was a nice hotel if you can let little things go. lets face it, you don't spend much time in the hotel anyway in a city like Rome and it was absolutely fine for what we needed. *money wise - we heard alot about it being very expensive but if you look around a bit then you will find that isn't the case. 4 quid for a can of sprite is bad - but if you keep your wits about you it's not an issue. watch out for the flower men! they are pesky! and will do just about anything to get you to buy a rose!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowd...”
Reviews.Author: LondonLal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Veneto is probably typical of many Rome hotels-not brilliant but pleasant enough. Rome is a very expensive city to stay in-not helped at the moment by the Euro. If you want to stay in a pleasant area with a little bit of a journey to central Rome then this is the place for you. It was very nice to come back to this quieter area of Rome at the end of a busy sightseeing day-and Rome is very busy! The hotel room we stayed in was billed as 'Deluxe'-really it meant that it was slightly bigger than average. However, the room was very clean and the bathroom very good. It is nice to be in a hotel as you do get the room tidy every day and clean towels! Breakfast is the usual european style-again OK, not brilliant. The minor moans are that the hotel 'forgot' our drink on arrival and they charge 5 euro for the use of the internet! All the staff were pleasant and spoke good English(better than our Italian!) Restaurants in the area are very expensive (the 'recommended' one next door very dear!) There is a decent pizzeria near the American embassy down the road but it is an expensive business eating out in Rome. We used the city bus 110 for two days to get to grips with everything and that worked out well. The metro is good and the buses-all very cheap which is helpful! Also if you are going to Rome do book on line for the major attractions as the queues are huge and booking lets you by-pass most of these. Rome is one of those 'have to see' cities and doesn't disappoint the only thing is you need lots of dosh to really enjoy the whole experience!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: rachiex
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel for 3 nights. There was nothing wrong with this hotel, it was clean, staff were friendly and the breakfast was nice. We were able to walk to most of the major attractions and it only took us 15 mins to walk to the Spanish steps. There is also a cash machine across the road.
