We paid a little extra for a room upgrade after reading reviews that the standard rooms were very small and we were glad we did, the room we had was small with not a lot of room to move around in so i can't imagine how small the standard rooms were. With the increase we got a really nice bottle of wine. We did a lot of walking as even though the bus stop was near by we couldn't figure out how to use it even after instructions from the hotel staff!! The taxi's are very expensive. We booked 2 tours with circle line tours a trip to the Vatican and the Colosseum. We didn't go inside the Closseum as it was very expensive and you could see everything from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but don't stay here if you want breakfast before 7 otherwise good.”
Reviews.Author: hershambee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2010 when we took part in the Rome marathon. The hotel and rooms were nice and tidy and ok but on the day of the marathon when we asked for the early breakfast that we had agreed the day before the lady in the resturant seemed most unhelpful and my wife ended up running the marathon on just a doughnut and coffee which was less than ideal. We wouldn't stay here again if we were running as there is no swimming pool in the hotel or bath in the room. The walls were quite thin ( you could hear the switches for the bed side lamps next door swiching on and off and talking from next door quite easily )and we had a lot of noisy guests that seemed to be slamming doors through the night. but all in all not bad for a normal weekend away. All other staff were very nice and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be deceived by the adverts.”
Reviews.Author: MrsJamesGourmet
Reviews.Content: On arrival greeted with the words do you want to upgrade your room for £25 a night. Also told , there are no tickets to Coliseum ,as advertised and on booking confirmation. Not allowed on roof top garden restaurant. No jacuzzi. Beds in double room was two singles pushed together, not the luxury advertised. Air condition did not work.Room noisy due to heavy vehicles operating in early hours Bathroom was tiny , like a broom cupboard, the bath being only fit for a child. This was a 60 th birthday present from my girlfriend , unfortunately did not live upto standard of luxury advertised.The hotel Veneto was the tiny hotel in via Piedmont, not the corner hotel shown on the advert. The nicest thing we can say was that the buffet breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “OK as a cut price deal.”
Reviews.Author: KarenMidSussex
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly but as 4 star hoels go, it was not all you would expect. The room was clean if a little small. We travelled as part of a package with a cut price deal but would have been disappointed if we had paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Comfortable, Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lanie17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Veneto/Romanico Palace for three nights over Valentines Day for the England/Italy rugby game. The staff were very friendly and informative giving us a map on arrival and highlighting all the best tourist attractions etc. The rooms although snug were very comfortable with a good bathroom and an excellent shower. We had a minibar in the room and air conditioning. Although we didn't eat in the Hotel Restaurant, the breakfasts were fine with a terrace area looking over the Rome rooftops. The Hotel recommended the Restaurant Marinaro right next to the Hotel. It was fabulous with wonderful food and a lovely family feel to it. We ate there three times with other friends at the hotel. Overall a very good hotel with a very reasonable 50 euro private shuttle car to and from the airport. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, little gem of a hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: marenaind
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay in Rome, four of us- parents, daughter and granddaughter and stayed at the Hotel Veneto. We've have stayed there four times in the last several years. Service is outstanding here and the ambiance is that of romantic old-world style. Best of all is the location. Up the street from the American Embassy, very safe neighborhood and within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and of course the Via Veneto. Rooms are small but elegant and with very modern bathrooms. Breakfast is included and is served in the roof top garden restaurant. It's quiet and lovely. The only drawback is that the restaurant is not open in the evening if you want a snack. If you're looking for nightlife, nightclubs, etc then this place isnt for you. If you're looking for a pretty, comfortable and safe hotel with great service and also a fair price then this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KerLan
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter Hotel Veneto, you know you made a very good choice. We arrived mid morning knowing our room wouldn't be ready until mid afternoon at the earliest. The staff were very helpful, holding our bags and giving us a tour of the hotel. we were offered an upgrade on our room, but found our pre booked duluxe room perfect for our needs. Our room was very comfortable, and thoroughly clean. A good sized safe was available in the room which for me is a must have option. A very nice bathroom with large shower and jucuzzi bath, made more comfortable with pleasant under floor heating. We only ate breakfast at the hotel. A good continental selection was made available. We had breakfast on the rooftop terrace which had a wonderful view over the city, and I could imagine a summers morning here would be an experience in itself. Every single member of staff were very friendly, very helpful and most importantly very polite. The location of the hotel is excellent for seeing all the popular and the lesser known sites in the city. Information on these were provided at reception. My use of the Italian language is extremely limited. However the staff communicated with excellent English. We were offered a return service to the airport. This was arranged by the very friendly and helpful 'Gianni'. The service is more expensive than a taxi, but worth every cent. Reading some other reviews on here that came across as negative makes me think that the reviewer hasn't embraced the experience of Rome. If I wanted all the comforts of home, I wouldn't need to travel! We will definitely be returning when we have the chance. The 'Hotel Vento' was part of our Rome experience. Thank you to every member of staff that made our stay so memorable. Alan & Kerry. UK.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not four star!”
Reviews.Author: Ome17
Reviews.Content: After looking at the pictures on various websites I was quite looking forward to my stay at Hotel Veneto. On arriving at the hotel I was greeted by the receptionist who offered to upgrade our room for an additional 25 euros a night. I declined and asked if I could be taken to the room allocated to us instead. But the receptionist was adamant on showing us her “favourite rooms". The two rooms on display were fantastic but I was not going to fork out any more cash on accommodation. After all the hotel was graded as four star so I expected all rooms to be decent. And it did already cost me a little over £650 for a 3 night stay so I assumed it would be pleasant. On seeing that I was not going to be splashing out any more cash she made a call from the display room to see if our room was ready (I have a feeling it was to find out which was the worst room she could get us into). We finally got shown to our room and that was a huge disappointment. The carpets were very dated; there was no couch, nor a view from the room making it even duller. The bathroom was clean but not at all attractive. I am average size (1.62m weighing 50 kg) and I found it really tiny. My companion is 1.8m and weighs 100 kg and I can only imagine the struggle he had having a shower. After reading the reviews I didn’t expect tea making facilities in the room but some tissues at least would have been nice! Breakfast was pretty basic- cereals, pastries, cold meats and beverages. The first night of sleep was horrible. I’d expect at least a decent night of rest from a four star hotel. But it turns out there were two single beds that were placed together and through the night the gap between these two got wider making it very uncomfortable. After explaining the discomfort through the night and the aches we were experiencing we were told that they would tie the beds together! Not exactly my idea of what a four star hotel should be offering!

Reviews.Title: “Only saw the reception desk”
Reviews.Author: VillaDS
Reviews.Content: Difficult to review the quality as we were informed on arriving at 6pm that "there had been an error with the booking". The 'apology' was rather superficial. We were transferred to the Hotel Imperiale in Via Veneto (which turned out to be a better location) and informed this was a better hotel. The booking had been made for weeks (through lastminute.com so not sure who was to blame). From the reviews it appears this isn't the first time this has happened.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Weekend”
Reviews.Author: g4Sandman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in October. This hotel fitted what we were after for when looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good location. This hotel has comfortable, nay grand, rooms, and a good continental breakfast. The staff are very helpful and spoke English. They also accepted my attempts at Italian pleasantly. The rooms are not huge but were more than generous for the two of us. The view from our window was great, looking out over the city. The Triton fountain, Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps are easy walking distance. Vatican is walkable, but takes about an hour at a leisurely pace, stopping to take photos. Barbebrini and the Termi station (10 mins) are easy walking too. Rome is a fab place to visit. We had a great romantic weekend for my birthday. I would recommend this hotel. Only down side - paying extra for internet when staying in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KC0234
Reviews.Content: At some point in my booking process on the Hotel's website I was informed that I would have a junior suite in the Residenza Romanico (sister and adjoining hotel) for 169 Euro per night. I booked for 7 nights as we were meeting with friends from Australia. Unfortunately I couldn't get a flight on Friday 30/10/09, so I booked a flight back for Thursday 29th. I went back onto the hotel website to change my reservation, but found I was unable to do so without cancelling my original booking and making a new one. I sent a feedback message through the website to change from a 7 to a 6 night booking. On arrival I was asked how many nights we wished to stay for and I replied 6. Reception did not comment on this. We were initially show to a room on the 1st floor, which was clearly not a junior suite. It was very small. I protested and was shown to a room on the 2nd floor, which - while bigger - again was clearly not a junior suite. I again protested and was shown to a room on the 6th floor which, while far superior to the other rooms was not what I would have expected of a junior suite. There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room and when we enquired about this we were told that we must use room service if we required any drinks, or use the bar. There was no free internet access. At checkout I was told that I must pay for 7 nights as that was my original booking. I did not argue as I had a taxi booked to take me to the airport and I was afraid of being late for my flight, but I was extremely displeased. We have stayed at hotels all over the world, of various grades, and this was the first time we have ever not had a kettle and tea and coffee provided. The decor of the hotel is very grand but the furniture is quite impractical. There are too few drawers provided and only 1 chair even in our larger room, though there was a chaise longue type piece of furniture. I was extremely disappointed and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Although the junior staff were fine, the reception staff were extremely aloof. We did discover a lovely friendly restaurant on the same block calle LeLuLo, which even has a smoking room and reasonable prices. Rome is very expensive - particularly as the exchange rate £ to Euro is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kimberdragon
Reviews.Content: We got this 4 star hotel for £10 each per night room only. The room was very small but fantastically decorated, 10ft head board about a million count egyptian cotton sheets and hydrotherapy power shower, massage thig amazing for the price we got it. The staff are fantastic in there, funny, helpful everything you would want. We looked on the room door and the price for our room per night was 500 euros.... we really did get a bargain. We felt safe in the area, close to the spanish steps and trevi fountain, just amazing place loved every minute of it. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel, get a 4 euro ticket for the day and you can use buses and metro. We just got on the bus and went to wherever it took us, we went everywhere it was fantstic.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: bristolmusky
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Veneto - PLEASE PLEASE ignore bad reviews - it was lovely. Our room - 601 - was beautiful. It was very spacious, had everything you need (except kettle). We needn't have taken any toiletries, it was all there, and fully replenished if used. Bedding, and towels were changed daily. The outside spa bath was amazing - perfect for throbbing feet and aching leg muscles after walking for hours and miles. All staff we came into contact with were helpful and cheerful. Breakfast is what you would expect from continental style. There was plenty of choice, and being help yourself you could sit and eat and eat if you wished. We didn't feel hungry until late at night. The hotel is situated in a quiet area so no traffic noise. It is not as close to some attractions as you would think from the map, however the open top tour bus was great. We did walk to the Spanish Steps, which took 15 minutes. Also walking you find some hidden gems, beautiful churches and lovely little restaurants. We did walk back form the Vatican, but this was done over a few hours, stopping to see other major attractions such as the Pantheon, market square and Trevi Fountains, and of course for the odd cappuccino or glass of wine. All I can say is that everyone should visit Rome once in their lifetime, it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: winchcombe1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in September after booking offer on Last.Minute.com. Previous reviews on Trip Advisor left me slightly apprehensive but I should not have been. This hotel ticked all of our boxes when looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good location. This hotel has comfortable rooms, good continental breakfast and very helpful staff who spoke great English. The rooms are not huge but this city is thousands of years old, what do you expect! If you want a larger room then go for an anonymous corporate hotel but for us the room had everything we needed. We booked the hop on hop off bus before we got to Rome and pretty much used it as our public transport for 2 whole days as there is a stop virtually outside the hotel. The Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps are easy walking distance, Metro steps only few minutes away. Helpful reception staff recommended inexpensive local restaurants to us and we also enjoyed restaurants in Trastevere. Rome is a fab place to visit, public transport is easy to use and inexpensive and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pre-paid but no room for us - transferred to a far inferior hotel”
Reviews.Author: KVDC1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Veneto at 9 am exhausted after an 8 hour flight from the US and were RUDELY told that they did not have a room for us. It seemed from the way they handled us that they routinely overbook and force people to an inferior hotel and pocket the pre-paid money. We were furious!!!!!!!!! We had done a ton of research in selecting our hotel and to be told that in spite of having a reservation (which was pre-paid) that no rooms would be available in the hotel for the 4 days we had planned is unacceptable. We were not given any explanation except they didn't have a room. That's it! They put us in a cab to a dump of a hotel and were forced to stay they for the entire trip. Never book with them!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY, TERRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 weeks in Italy, stayed in 5 different hotels: this was the worst by far: VERY unpleasant, condescending male desk clerks; terrible rooms, lousy breakfast and every chance they got to charge for something, that other hotels provided gratis, they did. For example, we wanted access to our room one hour before scheduled check in time, it was provided at an additional charge of 35 Euros. You're wasting your $ if you stay here...they make Motel 6 look like the Ritz. Caveat Emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VivianinNYC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome today and wanted to give a review for Hotel Veneto. I really don't understand some of the complaints that I've read. It's really a very nice hotel. Good location, nice breakfast buffet and polite, courteous and very helpful staff. Our bed, was very comfortable. We had clean towels everyday. We walked to the Spanish Steps in 15 minutes and also short walks to other main streets and sites. There are many different buses that stop right around the corner from the hotel. Our room was small but big enough. Our bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was very nice, all marble and a great shower. We checked out of the hotel very early and we were even give a little bag with a compliment breakfast snack for our trip. I would definately return here and also would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest room I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: jasper070
Reviews.Content: The location was ok for a stay in Rome but when we were shown to our room we thought they had made a mistake. We had booked a double room and what we got was a box that measured about 4 metres by 2.5 metres, plus a small bathroom. Although they had managed to squeeze a double bed in there, you could only get in and out from 1 side. We got the impression that it had been a single room because the light above the bed was positioned for a single bed but they'd tried to made more money by squeezing two people in there. Utterly claustrophobic! What's more the decor was shabby and dated - a complete rip-off for 150 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jackyboywisconsin
Reviews.Content: How this hotel would advertise its self as four stars is beyond me. My wife and I stayed here on the last leg of our Honeymoon. This hotel has certainly seen better days. Perhaps it once deserved fours stars but no longer. The carpets, wallpaper, and furniture are worn and stained. It bills itself as smoke free but our room reeked of cigarettes. The staff is rude and arrogant. Their advice on the city consisted of a cheap paper map and some brochures on tours. The would not allow me to take a cup of coffee out of the restaurant and back to our room. They would only allow there over priced room service to do this. We booked this hotel through Orbitz. Don't believe what Orbitz says about this hotels location. It is not close to any of the popular sites in Rome. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Choice For our Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: HappyAnn61
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay despite some mixed reviews and were really pleased we took the chance. The room was beautifully decorated. Whilst a little small it was perfectly in keeping with the city and the age of the building and the bathroom was lovely. The bed was great too! The location was great, just a 10 minute walk from the Piazza Barberini and the Via Veneto. We also found some lovely restaurants within easy walking of the hotel, and the area was quiet and safe. Breakfast was served in a lovely room and all the staff were friendly and helpful. We made the visit for our silver wedding anniversary and we had the perfect stay for such an occasion. We have no hesitation in recommening this hotel for a friendly and comfortable stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, good rates, safe area”
Reviews.Author: deesIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome today after a few days staying in this hotel. I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome. It is in a lovely area, quite close to the centre and a very respectable neighbourhood. Rooms were surprisingly spacious and rates were reasonable. Rooms were also well cleaned every day. Staff were pleasant with maybe one exception, but there's always one!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay.”
Reviews.Author: acgwinn
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a nice stay. The sister hotel next door, Hotel Romanico Palace, is nicer and a good value. Hotel Veneto is also nice and slightly less expensive. Our room was nice, though small. The bathroom was fine, though very small and the shower did not drain properly. The breakfast was good and the service for the breakfast was great. The desk-staff however was surly and a little rude. However, the desk-staff at Hotel Romanico Palace was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location. undoubtedly a good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: romai
Reviews.Content: The hours we spent on the web trying to found out if what was written in "tripadvisor" about hotel venento was correct, came out to be worth the try. Me and my girlfriend came back from hotel veneto after a great 6 nights. We found there a great helpful stuff, that made an efforts to please us. We got a clean and NOTsmall room with a great shower, tv, comfortable bed and above all- it was a cheap 4 star hotel in very expensive city, and with a walk or one short ride from everywere in the city! If you are not looking for a view from your room but want all of the above, its for you! recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TeddyBruce
Reviews.Content: Clean, adequate rooms. Great location, quite neighborhood, only a few minutes walk to the Via Veneto. Very helpful staff. Their restaurant recommendations were fantastic. Perfect boutique hotel. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again.”
Reviews.Author: JCS5
Reviews.Content: *As I love walking (and this is a wonderful city for walking around!) I enjoyed thoroughly my 8-day exploration of Rome by foot and found Hotel Veneto very central for this purpose. The 3km to The Vatican area took about 40minutes, the 1.5km to The Colosseum took about 20mins. and, of course, other tourist attractions like The Spanish Steps,Trevi Fountain and Galleria/Gardens Borghese, being so much closer to the hotel, took only minutes to reach (I do go quickly) . *Although I had one of the rooms which has not yet been upgraded, I found it very quiet, comfortable and well-serviced, with all bed linen and towels changed daily. *Nothing was ever any trouble for the extremely helpful, friendly staff who dealt immediately with all queries and requests. * The hotel's buffet breakfast offers a very good and varied selection of foods including juices, tea/coffee,fresh, dried and tinned fruits, yogurts, cereals,meat,cheese, salad, hot dish,bread /toast and rolls. I was very pleased that breakfast was included in the cost of my room. *Unfortunately, any time I wished to have a brief catch-up of "The News", I managed to get only one of the three promised English- speaking channels on the bedroom TV and this invariably featured "sport". Perhaps when all the rooms have been upgraded the TVs will be also! *As an over-60, solo female, non-Italian speaking tourist visiting Rome for the first time, I looked carefully for good, safe, central accommodation and was delighted with my choice of Hotel Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: morgaine79
Reviews.Content: Hotel Veneto is a luxurious hotel placed in a wonderful location. The hotel has a renaissance feeling to it but with all the modern comforts as well as being clean and very well organised. The staff was very polite and always extremely helpful: they booked restaurants, trips around the city and gave advice on anything and everything. The hotel is very central, close to the main station and to most of the main attractions of the Eternal city. It has been a pleasure to visit Rome whilst staying in Hotel Veneto and we will definitely be staying there again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasurable stayp”
Reviews.Author: clydeshatner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Veneto during our two week stay in Italy. We found the staff to be very helpful. Rooms were very clean with modern bath facilities. The rooftop bar is a great place to enjoy a before dinner cocktail, with exceptional service and enjoyable views of the city. We do recommend booking tours and excursions from home, allowing you to check for reviews. The excursions we booked through the hotel were disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: stewnew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Veneto for 2 nights and would recommend to anyone as a base to visit the sights of Rome. termini station only about 10 min walk away and and all the main sights are close enough to walk to as well. Breakfast was ok if you're not fussy and the coffee served was very good. All staff were friendly and helpful. the only minor niggle was the room could have done with an update as wear and tear was evident.Dont let that put you off though, as everyone says you only use the room as a place to sleep really and the room was cleaned daily with fresh towels etc overall a very nice hotel which we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump. Never go there. Its a squalid dump”
Reviews.Author: 365drills
Reviews.Content: Had booked Hotel Romanico Palace (next door) then on arrival and without explaination dragged up the street and dumped into Hotel Veneto. And what a dump this place turned out to be. My wife is pregnant and at week 26 this is supposed to be the last holiday we can fly on so wanted to go to Rome for something special. But the hotel room was dirty as well as pokey. Both hotels failed to explain why we were being relocated from the Four Star Romanico. The PHOTOS WE SAW were of an elegant contemporary room. Crisp linen. What we ended up in was a flea pit. I am busy contacting our tour operator Last Minute DC to try to get the refund for the £700 trip which was done via Easyjet and for 3 nights. Value for money? No. No. No. PS: The trip was booked 2 months ago ! so not "last minute"

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - just a shame it is in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bouncing_Fin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and upgraded to a room with the jacuzzi bath. The room was spotless (along with the rest of the hotel) and plenty big enough. The only fault we could find with the hotel was that they charge for orange juice with the breakfast (4 Euro). Rome as a whole is extremely expensive and unfriendly. I paid 21 Euro for a beer and a water, and 81 Euro for a 2 course meal with wine. The best tip I could give is buy a ticket for the Red double decker sightseeing bus (20 Euro for 48 Hours) and use it as a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Odd rooms, expensive roof bar”
Reviews.Author: forsbha
Reviews.Content: When we arrived - we called the hotel upfront, to inform that we are arriving late. At that time the personnel just wished us welcome, so we took a taxi to the hotel when we arrived in the evening, but: At the reception they told us that there had been a challenge with their it-system and they had no rooms available - the receptionist informed we had a room for 2 of the 4 nights we were supposed to stay at the hotel, and we had to go to another hotel two blocks away for the first two nights. The hotel we were guided to was hotel Londra - actually a good hotel, we would have preferred to stay there for the whole visit. When we two days later checked in to this hotel, the room we got (which was supposed to be an upgraded room), the room was a big disappointment: The colors and the design of the room and the furnitures was awful, the walls were dark blue / grey and the furniture were painted with a color of gold. There were no place to get electricity to the laptop or mobile phone if you didn't choose to unplug a lamp or the television. The cupboard in the bathroom, was damaged by the water from the shower. There is a nice bar on the roof of the hotel, but it was open only for a couple of hours in the late afternoon / evening, and the price of a glass of wine was 7€, this I consider very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCaff
Reviews.Content: I found the website pictures to be very misleading! The rooms are TINY, TINY, TINY!! We booked this hotel for a 7 day stay and could not even unpack our suitcases because there was no dresser, no drawers, and only 3 hangers. And the minibar (which gave off tremendous heat) is in the armoire which also included the safe, thus there is no room to hang anything. The only nice thing I can say about the room was the rain shower, but the shower itself was also tiny. The breakfast staff was pleasant, however the front desk staff was very unfriendly and cold, unwelcoming. Also, the hotel is not located as closely to the Spanish Steps (and other sites) as the website would have you believe. We also got ripped off by the taxi driver taking us from the train station to the hotel, charged us 20 euro, should only be 10-15. We did not spend a lot of time in the room, however I expected much more and did not look forward to going to the hotel each night. All in all I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to explore Rome!”
Reviews.Author: lovingholidays80
Reviews.Content: We always check the reviews on tripadvisor before our holidays, and this time my husband and I (on our honeymoon) were slightly concerned by some previous guest comments. However we found the hotel had great staff who were always very friendly and happy to help, the room was very clean and decorated nicely, breakfast was good, the mini bar was reasonably priced, the shower was great with jets (no bath though which did not bother us), the car from the airport that the hotel offered to organise was good value and took the hassle out of the transfer, and even with an internal facing room (No. 126) - yes there was no view - but the room was quiet and air conditioned. The hotel is 5 mins from the Hard Rock Cafe and Via Veneto and a great location for seeing the sights, 10 mins walk from the Trevi fountain! I would recommend this as a reasonably priced hotel to base yourself for a trip to see Rome. However I would mention that we are a couple who are out and about most of the time and do not spend much time in the hotel favouring sightseeing at every opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back if we ever are lucky enough to return to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: BergenEngel
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff contributed to making our 5 nights stay a most memorable one! Nice and clean hotel. Our only objection was the size of our room, but that was of minor importance. Excellent location for exploring many of the wonderful sights, and the Metro at walking distance. We never regretted having chosen Hotel Veneto and hope to be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back...”
Reviews.Author: SMFrancois
Reviews.Content: Hotel Veneto is such an ideal place to stay... a few blocks from Via Veneto - quite a nice strip with famous Cafes such as "Cafe De Paris", the cafe where Valentino & Giancarlo started the legacy of the label! The front desk was very helpful, esp. the concierge, Ilaria - who booked all of my tours during my entire stay with them (tours of Rome, shopping, restaurants etc). Traveling alone, I felft very secure and well taken care of. Their breakfast staff and evening bartender(s) were also very hospitable. I will certainly be back, bringing along some friends & will most probably stay at Hotel Veneto again.

Reviews.Title: “Derserving of a 3 star and not a 4 star hotel. Great location,though!”
Reviews.Author: red2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and i recently stayed at Hotel Veneto and while it was a fantastic location, the hotel was disappointing. The hotel's official website and the holiday website used to book it grades it as a 4 star hotel but i feel that it was 3 star. Our room did not meet the 4 star rating as it was very small, cramped and dark and overlooked the interior of the hotel. Although our bathroom was clean, there was no bath but only a tiny shower. Some of the decoration was very much outdated. I have no complaints about the staff; they were very courteous, helpful and friendly and always answered our questions. We complained about our taxi driver who drove us to the hotel and he charged us a whopping 30 euros for a 5 minute journey! The member of staff on duty immediately rang the taxi firm however nothing could be done as we did not have the code/reference number for this particular taxi driver and is accomplice (yes there were two of them, very intimidating when we refused to pay the ridiculous fare and locked the doors when we wanted to get out. They refused to let us check the meter and demanded the 30 euros. We were so shocked with this behaviour so just paid and got out very quickly! Really bad experience! The hotel is in a great location, near the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps and we really enjoyed the open bus tour. It's in a very safe and clean area however the bars and restaurants were very pricey! Most evenings we were paying over the odds for a bottle of house wine and beer. On our last evening we got chatting to a lovely guy who worked on the open tour buses who recommended that we go to Travestere. We did and found some fantastic bars and restaurants in this area and paid below 40 euros! The breakfast was served with lovely coffee, fresh fruit, cheese, cereals and bread rolls and lots more. My only big disappointed was our room which i felt was tiny,poky and lacked so much. We asked if we could change our room however were told we would have to pay an extra 50 euros ! However if you are not too concerned about rooms, then this hotel is a great location for all the brilliant sights. Be prepared to pay high prices for food and alcohol though, if you want to stay in Veneto! Once again my biggest gripe was paying over the odds for a room that was most certainly 3 star and not 4 star!! .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Veneto 4* Hotel or more like a 3*?”
Reviews.Author: AnnaD80
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have just recently come back from Rome staying for 5 nights at the Hotel Veneto. To keep it short we found the reception staff very rude and when asked if there was an iron we could use for an hour we were told that iron's were forbidden in the hotel. I found it unbelievable that a 4* hotel did not allow iron's so we went out and bought one. Also when we first checked into the hotel my boyfriend asked the receptionist whether he spoke English, his reply was English when you are in Italy! Like the other reviews on Trip advisor our room was very small but clean. The other staff like the bar man, breakfast waiters and the cleaners were all very polite. If I had to compare this hotel to the standard in England I would rate this Hotel as a 3*. It was definitely not a 4* hotel. Premier Travel Inns are better quality and more equipped than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gudinuf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Hotel Veneto, and while it was in a beautiful location, the hotel itself was a disappointment. The hotels official website, and the website I booked it through classed it as a 4 star, but I feel the room we were staying in was well below this. Our room was small, and cramped, with a view into the interior. Bizarrely, the room had no bedside lighting, just a strong and unflattering light above the bed. The bathroom, was clean but small, and very grubby in terms of decor. I couldn't help but feel I'd taken a step back in time to the 80's throughout my entire stay. Maybe it is a case of you get what you paid for, but the room we were in was not cheap. The staff were lovely, especially in the bar. Very friendly and warm which was a nice contrast to most Italians. I would suggest that anyone seriously considering booking this hotel bare in mind that the hotel classification system in Italy bares little resemblance to other countries and only covers facilities. My biggest issue was, I was paying 4 star prices for a room that was 3 if not 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lucyloue
Reviews.Content: When you first enter the hotel it looks nice, very clean and tidy, however the carpeting off the main foyer up the stairs etc is very very shabby and dirty. As this is a 4 star hotel our initial reaction when we entered the hotel room was disappointment. The room was furnished to an acceptable standard and looked clean and tidy but what you don't see in the official hotel pics is how shabby the bedroom walls are ( they need a paint job asap), the bathroom was okay, again clean and tidy but spoiled by the bath which looked a bit shabby (wouldn't want to take a bath), also the shower wasn't that great. Couldn't fault the cleaning staff though as the room was kept very clean and tidy. The room was very hot when we arrived in the evening as the heating was turned up very high and we ended up having to call down a few times to reception before that got sorted. Breakfast was fine, only complaint was the coffee which tasted like the really cheap stuff you buy in bulk. The main complaint and the one that was the most disappointing was the attitude of the hotel staff. Having read some of the other reviews about how friendly the hotel staff were i think they must have been staying somewhere else!? We were polite and friendly in all are dealings with the hotel staff, but they were off hand and acted as if it was too much effort to smile and be friendly or actually have basic manners. The worst place we encountered this was at the reception desk. When we checked out and paid our bill the credit card was slammed down on the counter and it seemed an effort for the staff member to say a thank you or a goodbye....disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: raws1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location all the main attractions are within walking distance!!! The hotel is quiet as is located just outside the main tourist area. The hotel staff are friendly and extremely helpful. I would particularly recommend the hotel to couples but its suitable for anybody wanting to see the charm of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: IkeEsq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at Hotel Veneto for two nights in September 2007 as part of a Virgin-Vacations package. We liked the hotel, which we found clean and inexpensive (as part of our tour). We used the Wi-Fi in the hotel and enjoyed breakfast in the top-floor lounge. It is not all that convenient to the main sites in Rome. It is a bit of a hike to the nearest Metro stop (and most sites are a bit of a walk from the Metro as well), but we enjoy walking, so it was nice for us. It is a fairly short taxi ride from Termini. The staff were pleasant. The room was about as big as one would expect, given the price. It was clean and we had no complaints. The room had a double bed, t.v., phone, chair, desk, and wardrobe. Of note, the picture of the large hotel on the corner is misleading. Hotel Veneto is to the left of the large hotel on the corner. However, it was easy to recognize that we were in the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: eldextero
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved this hotel: the staff were friendly and quite helpful, the location of the hotel was easy to find and in a nice area, the breakfast was great, and the room was quite pretty (though a little dark, as someone else already said). As a college student staying there, I felt a little out of place as I am used to places that are much cheaper looking but luckily found a good deal for the room on a student site. When we got there, I was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was-- the lobby is very pretty and smelled nice and there is a lovely bar just beside it. Overall I found it pretty classy. My only complaints are with the room as the outside traffic was a little noisy (i think our window might have been broken and was unable to latch shut properly) and the small tv is placed very high on the wall so you have to lay down to watch it. The huge cabinets/armoires in the room are pretty but I find the size of them unnecessary. Maybe downgrading to something smaller would allow the tv to be moved down and will open up the dark room more? Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and if you can find a good deal there i would definitely take advantage of it!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: smozzinator
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. I booked through a well-known travel website, and paid a reasonable sum per night (over 100 Euros) so expected the accommodation to be pretty decent, given that the location of the hotel is out of the main tourist area and wouldn't attract top-dollar rates accordingly. I read the reviews on this site before booking, and the most recent ones were glowing, so I was expecting the hotel to be pretty good. It wasn't. When booking, I'd asked for a room with a view, but in fact it faced into a dismal internal courtyard, through which noise echoed upwards. The room was small and dark, and furnished sparsely (there was a large comfortable bed, but only a small desk and chair, and the TV high on the wall so you had to lie on the bed to watch it). There was only 1 pillow each, but supplies in the bathroom were adequate, as were the hangers and hanging space in the wardrobe. The jacuzzi shower looked great, but flooded the bathroom (and the side jets didn't work). The staff on the front desk weren't rude or stand-offish, but they weren't particularly friendly either (perhaps because of the strong smell in the reception area, where the was an over-enthusiastic amount of fragranced oil in a display). The waiting staff in the breakfast room were very pleasant, and the food itself was great (tip - ask for an espresso rather than drink the coffee available in the self-dispenser). All in all, the hotel was disappointing value for money. I wouldn't go back - having compromised location in favour of what I thought would be better value for money, I feel we were let down. My advice: go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Veneto”
Reviews.Author: e36s
Reviews.Content: Our group of four found this hotel perfect for our 4 day stay. Newly renovated, this quaint hotel has a courteous and accommodating staff willing to help whenever requested. We found the location ideal and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RDHD
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and really enjoyed it! Upon check-in we were immediately provided with a map of the surrounding areas and were offered assistance with our luggage. The elevator is extremely slow, but our room was on the first floor so it didn't affect us adversely. The room itself was very nice...The bed was comfy and the bathroom had a huge bathtub/jacuzzi type thing that was so relaxing after traipsing around Rome every day. The room was also nice and quiet. The buffet breakfast was tasty and they offer free espresso, cappuccino, etc. at the bar next to the buffet room. I also discovered a love for Parmalat coconut yogurt that i didn't know i had.... The service that we received was first rate. Each person that we met at the hotel was extremely friendly and willing to assist us. At one point we were trying to contact a tour company that was supposed to pick us up early one morning and hadn't arrived (we booked a one day tour prior to our arrival). The concierge just picked up the phone, dialed the number, spoke to someone and assured that we would be picked up in a half hour. Then he offered us cappuccinos while we waited. Nice! I will say that the hotel is a little bit farther from the sites than you might expect, but if you don't mind walking a short way to get to the Spanish Steps or the Trevi then it's the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Veneto, Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: tinatot76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Veneto twice. In Sept 2006 and Sept 2007. Far from the sites but a decent hotel. Very clean and good service. We were happy to walk everywhere to be somewhere a bit more quiet and less congested. Be prepared to walk about 15 mins just to the closest train station. Local food options just okay, but the supermarket is three blocks away which is a score, as we tend to stock up on water and goodies to take back to the room and home. The elevator is small, small, small so we walked up and down from our 5th floor room. The breakfast was decent. Would def stay there again. Enjoy~

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of a 3 star !”
Reviews.Author: OCEAN_8
Reviews.Content: Great location!! Via Veneto not too far a walk! I would rate the hotel as average. Lobby very small, rooms dark due to heavy drapery. we stayed one night, don't think I'd pick this hotel for any longer. Rooms on the small side although large dresser with drawers No indoor parking. Cost for outdoor parking 35 Euro per day. Can not comment on incldusive breakfast, had to catch an early flight and breakfast started at 7:30 am Staff friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “not the best hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: crisrob123
Reviews.Content: Hotel Veneto is not the best 3 star hotel we've ever stayed in but it has a really good location, not far from Via Veneto. The reception area is very small, with no lounge and bar area that we could see or use, although the information we read on the internet said to the contrary. The bedroom was small, outdated with blue embossed wallpaper and old fashioned italian replica furniture badly in need of replacement, however it was clean and had air conditioning. The breakfast was taken in the adjoining hotel and was on the roof top with great views across Rome, although the first day was a nightmare as we queued for about 30mins with the harrassed waitress running around trying to please everyone, They also frequently ran out of the basic provisions but very quickly replaced them when asked and was always very polite. If you wanted a drink at the end of the day you also had to go to the adjoining hotel, which was no major problem as you could walk straight through from one hotel to the other without going into the street. All in all the hotel was ok for what we paid. The hotel staff were very friendly and courteous and if you are the sort of people like us that doesn't spend a lot of time in the hotel only to sleep then it is perfectly adequate. Rome itself is absolutely beautiful with great things to see. Do take the open top green hop on hop off bus for a cost effective, great way to explore this great city. You can buy a 12 or 48 hour pass and use it as many time as you want. It also has a running commentry of interesting facts as you go round in all different languages. I would go back to Rome like a shot but would stay on the other side near Trevi Fountain and the Panthenon as it was quite expensive where we were. We paid nearly 20 euros for a normal glass of wine and 0.4cl of beer, and our evening meal with just one course and a bottle of wine cost on average 70 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A promising hotel”
Reviews.Author: The-Two-Trippers
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was only 2 nights. On arrival at the hotel it didn't look impressive from outside, however you should never judge a book by its cover! Location was good within easy walking distance of Trevi Fountain, spanish steps. It Is located in what seemed to be the financial district, however close to via veneto... lots of modern/chic bars and restaurants. The hotel is currently undergoing renovation work, but it didn't interfere with our stay. Nice interior of the hotel, very clean and evidently been recently improved. Concierge are very helpful in bringing luggage up to your room. The room we stayed in was a double deluxe bedroom (no 307) with jacuzzi bath and massage shower... don't be fooled into thinking you will have a big bathroom, it was very small and they have fitted too much into a tight room! Bath was just about big enough to fit one, but even that was a squeeze. Fixtures and fittings are luxurious, just a shame that there was the odd unfinished final touches that would have made it perfect (e.g. Towel rail plumbing fitted, minus the actual heated towel rail.) The bedroom -It had lovely marble floors and the features were typically Italian... very romantic! we were told it was a king-size bed... yeah pehaps in size, but two single beds put together and dressed like a king-size bed. Decor comprised of golds, creams and reds... very warm and cosy feel. Mini bar reasonably priced, and in room safe was a good feature. One downside to the bedrooms are that you can hear a little too much of your guests next door, above and below, walls are paper thin! Services - Mmmm..... room service - not strictly true, unless you are only thirsty and fancy a drink from the menu! Breakfast room is not as advertised on websites on top floor with panoramic views of rome, due to renovation we had to use a room on ground floor witch was a little disappointing, but i'm sure when renovations are over breakfast would be back on seventh floor. One last piece of advice... Don't take the hotels offer upon a private car from airport for 60 euros, white taxi cabs only cost a fixed price of 30 euros from airport into anywhere in centre of rome. We made the mistake of this for convenience, however the driver only knew our name and not the hotel we were staying at, so as you can imagine... the non english speaking driver and the not so good speaking italian passangers made for an interesting trip! How that works we still can't work out when it is arranged by the hotel themselves!! Overall impression was good, would use it again but pehaps once renovation is over.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: proceed_to_departure
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Veneto for 4 nights in July 07. The hotel is about a 10/15 minute walk from the Spanish steps and about 20/25 mins from the Piazza Nova. The lobby of the hotel is very small and the check in desk in located up a step, which isnt great when you are carrying large suitcases. There are 2 lifts which serve the 6 floors. One is modern and the other is old stly with the gate which you pull across before the door will close. Out room was ok in size, but seemed small when we arrived. The bed was close to the door, but after a day or so we got used to this. The hotel has narrow corridors. The bathroom was large and had a shower which had a seat in it. There was also a large mirror and sink. Our room had a safe and had 2 wardrobes, one at each side of the bed. We also had a tv which had CNN as the only English news channel. Also available were Italian TV, French and German. For breakfast we had to go to the breakfas room which was on the top floor of the hotel. For reading previous reviews and the hotels description, we had been informed that breakfast (during the summer months) was served on the hotels rooftop terrace, so when we discovered that the rooftop terrace was not open and was instead full of old outdoor furniture was a surpirse! We had been looking forward to eating outside in the heat but this never happend. There was no explination as to why this was closed or anything from the staff. The breakfast in the indoor room was average. Tea, coffee, fruit juice, ceral, bread, pastries. Nothing was available which was hot. Its a small room and a tight squeeze. The tea and coffee are not out of a macine, but are out of jugs which the staff have to continually change as when we went up, were mostly cold or there was not hot water/cofee/milk remaining. We just ate and go out as quickly as we could. Its an avarage hotel in a avarage location. Anyone visiting Rome should know that there is alot of walking and in the summer the heat can be un-bearable! The hotel did its purpose and was somewhee to sleep. For the price it was an ok place to stay. If your looking for somewhere to stay which is cheaper than the more well known hotels. but still gives you acess to the sights and a free breakfast thrown in, Id recommend this hotel. If your looking for luxuary or somewhere to relax at the end of the day in comfort I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller7007
Reviews.Content: Hotel with good amenities. Rooms large enough. Room, bathroom and linen were very clean. Breakfast was excellent and brought to the room for a small sum (3 euro). Staff were extremely attentive and helped book museum reservations and called taxis with no bother. Some redecorating being undertaken but it did not detract from the visit. Overall a very good experience during the five days of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: char4
Reviews.Content: this hotel was booked a fortnight before we went to rome for 2 nights, at a cost of £116 for a double room for 2 nights i was very impressed. the hotel is in an easy walking distance for the spanish steps and trevi fountain as well as the bus stop for the open top tour buses. also within a 5 min walk is the hard rock cafe-well worth a visit for the great food and livley atmosphere the hotel room itself was very spacious, complete with jacuzzi bath, flat screen tv, slippers, toiletries etc, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, they provided a map of the city one point to be wary off, we paid 30 euros for a taxi from the airport, when we asked the hotel to ring one for our retyurn we were quited 50 euros, so we declined and walked 2 streets to a taxi rank were the first taxi quoted 30 euros!

Reviews.Title: “A building site!”
Reviews.Author: Suewong
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms at the Hotel Romanico for a family celebration..On arrival we were moved to the adjacent Hotel Veneto. Builders were working throughout our 3 night stay. They left a trail of leads,dust , noise and building materials of which we had no prior knowledge or apology for. Heating and hot water were not working properley and the 24hour room service non-existant. Rooms were thankfully clean but breakfast was poor and eating area cramped . The staff were very pleasant and it seemed unfair them having to take all the complaints for a slack and uncaring management. This hotel needs to address these problems before their reputation is ruined prior to completing the refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor and location”
Reviews.Author: mmp1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful stay at this hotel on November 7,2007.. The location was convenient to everything and a short walk to the met. The rooms were immaculate and newly decorated with great lighting. The staff was very cordial and we were given a free glass of wine in the lovely bar area. The breakfast was upstairs in a room overlooking the city. We would defintely stay here again and have reccommended it to our son who is going there in December. It was close to the lovely Veneto area and we found a nice restaurant down the street. Great for a couple with the nice king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Gadget”
Reviews.Author: GadgetDerby
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Rome and would recommend it to anybody. With regards to negative reports regarding the hotel Veneto we were more than happy with the accommodation, the staff (barmen Marco & Angelo especially) and the location although must agree with other reports that the continental breakfast was a little bland. enjoyed a drink on the roof terrace but unfortunately unable to take breakfast up there. Guided tours although informative seemed a little expensive so we covered all sites ourself and thoroughly enjoyed either walking (watch the crossings) or taking the Metro (1 euro for a single fare). Expect at least a 2 hour queue for the Vatican Museum if going alone (in a lot quicker if you do take a tour) Make sure you tackle the steps and get to the top of St Peters Dome, well worth the climb.

Reviews.Title: “Misled!”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo3945
Reviews.Content: From their website the hotel looked OK, as at the end of the day we were only bed and breakfast so were not looking for good cuisine. However, breakfast was not exciting to say the least. Double room that we had was nice but walls were thin and every morning were awoken by American couple next door having a conversation at 5am! When we telephoned Reception to complain they told us to ring their room and tell them to keep quiet, to which we told them that it was down to them to do, so he reassured us that he would ring them and let them know. 20 mins later still no call so we had to call Reception again and within 5 mins they phoned and the talking stopped! By then the heavy traffic outside the hotel started to build up and even with the windows closed the noise was quite loud so not recommended for light sleepers! Location was also another issue as we were led to believe that the Spanish Steps were just around the corner - at least 20 mins walk and as the hotel is situated on one of Rome's many hills it was fine walking down in the morning but when you had been walking all day in the heat it was another thing walking back up to the hotel later in the day. I would recommend a hotel in the vicinity of the Trevi Fountain as this is central to most of the sights. Lastly the hotel manager, Nicola, was rude and unhelpful, he needs to go on an management course and learn some customer relation skills.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at " Hotel Veneto"”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlOH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Veneto for 4 nights in July 2007. We liked the convenient location of this hotel and its quite neighborhood (near American Embassy and Via Veneto). The room we stayed in wasn't large, but has mini-fridge and AC - "must have" during hot summer weather in Rome! The breakfast was usual "continental" fare - we liked the cappuccino from the machine and all the pastries there. The receptionist Francesco was very helpful and gave us lots of great advice. If you don't want to spend lots of money on eating out, there is a nice small grocery store "Despar" in 5 min walk from the hotel (about couple of blocks away) - Italian wine there was quite cheap and we really enjoyed it! Since the location of the hotel was very convenient, we walked to most of the sightseeing places on foot, but if you prefer bus, there was a bus stop nearby, but you will have to buy your bus tickets in the Tabacci store which is located further down the street. Taxis were in every "touristy" place and the ride to the hotel cost about 10 Euro. I would recommend this hotel to my friends - not very fancy, but affordable rooms near most of the important sights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Too Blue at the Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: MamaHenAlabama
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our travels in Italy 2 weeks ago. This hotel seemed to be well-known whenever we asked for directions, but I would not consider it "centrally located" as our agent suggested. Our room was a light blue from the fabric walls and bedspreads to the curtains, and then had a navy blue carpet. It was a bit much to take in and there was just enough room to walk around the beds, but not much. The first thing we noticed was that the bedspreads and the blankets were noticeably dirty. Not filthy, but clearly needing to be washed. I was unsure about how much complaining to do as the room was booked thru an agency and frankly we were gone for most of days we were in Rome. The lamps were obviously very inexpensive and one had clearly been glued back together. The cupboard with the refrigerator in it was so hot on the top that it made our plastic bags very hot. We considered that a fire hazard so moved everything away from it. Our bathroom was tiny and my child hit her head on the sink as she was standing up from using the toilet. She is 5'1. The walls outside our room were painted a light blue with a feather duster technique my mother used in my bedroom in the 1980s. Several ceiling tiles in the hall were out of place or dirty. We were given bagged breakfasts for the times we had to leave really early (which was thoughtful) and they contained juice boxes, jelly and a kind of melba toast that shattered when opened so we just drank the juices.

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars? Try One or None”
Reviews.Author: mandminoh
Reviews.Content: I don't know who rated this a three star hotel, but there's no way. The rooms haven't been updated for a while: the padded wallpaper was coated with dirt from the vents, mold covered the bathroom tiles and room ceiling, they tried to cover the mold with caulking in the bath, but that obviously didn't work. The location isn't that great, but that's mostly because Rome doesn't have the best public transport. The breakfast room has a spectacular view, but it's ruined by the staff. There's a shorter, older woman with black shoulder length hair that was so rude and nasty we (and several other guests) were laughing out loud. When we complained about her at the front desk we were met with stone silence. When we checked in the desk person seemed to think we were bothering him by simply being there. The porter was nice. Besides the porter, no on smiled and seemed to go out of their way to avoid you. We were happy to leave. Not a nice hotel, not convenient, not clean and the staff doesn't seem to know what hospitality is. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: sarahoconn
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the horrible reviews this hotel was given on this site I wasn't expecting much before I travelled. We were going over for a wedding and wanted something cheap, near enough to main attractions and clean....which was exactly what we got. There were 25 of us who stayed here and we all were very happy. I had a triple room which had a balcony and lovely views of the city. The bathroom was also quite big with a power shower and bath. Reception was small but I found them very helpful. The bar area was reasonably priced compared to the main strip Veneto! Overall we were very happy and would stay again. Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: KellyLondon
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here I was dreading my trip to Rome! However, my experience at the Hotel Veneto was a good one. The room was clean, as were the towels and bed sheets. It was a modern room of a decent size with all the amenties that you would expect for a 3 star hotel (electric safe, mini bar, air con etc). My boyfriend and I travel a lot and I have to say that this hotel was of a higher standard than some other 3 star hotels that we have stayed in. The location of the hotel is great, I read a comment that it takes 40 minutes to walk to the nearest attractions. We did not find this to be the case at all. Via Veneto is about 2 mins away and we walked to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountatin within 20 mins we even walked to the Pantheon within 30 mins! There are some reviews about bad service at the hotel but I found the service ok, not fantastic but ok. We asked the reception for spare pillows and they arrived within 5 mins, the check in/out process is very quick and easy. Traveller tip - Via Veneto is quite a quiet area so if you are looking for a bit of nightlife then I would recommend staying around Trastvere where the restaurants and bars are a lot busier and more affordable than around Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “veneto hotel makes you want to vomit”
Reviews.Author: georgethomson76
Reviews.Content: we booked a double room at this pathetic excuse for a 3 star hotel and we were very very dissapointed. Dirty rooms, a paltry breakfast and surly reception staff for the entire duration of our stay. The location isn't that good as the nearest monuments like the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon are at least 40 minutes walk away. The Colosseum is about an hour on foot and even with public transport it will take you at least half an hour to reach any major monument. we paid over 160 euro per night for our room and i have to say this is without doubt the worst hotel i have ever stayed in - avoid it all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravelerUSA
Reviews.Content: Please stay away from this hotel. Our room was dirty with a white film in the bathroom; the beds had no sheets or blankets just a mattress cover and comforter which was also dirty. Exposed wires were hanging out of the walls and the bathroom sink was being held up by a piece of wood. My wife and daughter have alergy's and we had to book a local hotel for the night. but they still charged us 350 euro which we know have to dispute. We have been traveling for years with this being by far the worst experience ever. Do not get caught in the trap of this hotel. There are two best westerns nearby at half the rate and are very clean with large rooms. Photo to follow USA New Yorker

Reviews.Title: “They've got the builders in”
Reviews.Author: UKPetey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in this hotel and although we had a great time in Rome, the hotel wasn't without its fair share of problems. Thankfully we spent most of our time out enjoying Rome so it wasn't a complete spoiler. The location of the hotel was pretty good and within walking distance to central Rome. Metro and bus services also nice and handy. Around Via Veneto is very attractive place filled mainly with Bank offices and swanky restaurants close by. It was very quiet at night, and we felt fairly safe walking along the street. Firstly the good points of the hotel: The hotel staff were very helpful checking us in and handling our baggage when we arrived late after our flight. The free map was very useful. Room sizes are fairly generous. Good size bed. Our standard double room had a 6' bed. The roof terrace looks great (if it were open during our stay). I should point out that most of our hotel problems during the stay have been because the builders have been round doing various things. Most of this should go away once they're finished. This has caused the following: Roof terrace closed. Drilling during the daytime. Wet paint all over the place. New fire doors installed in corridors (during our stay these were left without doorhandles over night). WiFi not available due to refurb? (so we were told anyway). Refurbished rooms partitioning lets a lot of sound through walls. Half way during our stay a very vocal group of people occupied rooms either side of ours, due to the thin walls, the singing in the shower sounded like it came from our own bathroom. Other things we were'nt impressed with: -Breakfast was rubbish. No hot food. Coffee alone spoilt breakfast (other people have mentioned it and its all true). Bread rolls, croissants, orange juice, yoghurts, and cerials only. (Eat breakfast down the road and get some real italian coffee instead.) -The bar is quite comfortable and looks very nice, but the service was practically non-existant. No newspapers in sight. No bar menus on tables. Nobody visiting tables to take your order.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Elegance”
Reviews.Author: WomanWithWanderlust
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Veneto for four nights at the end of February, and I have to say that the hotel exceeded our expectations. I think this is probably due to the fact that the hotel has undergone a pretty extensive rennovation and we had a newly rennovated room. The rooms are small and sparse but what is there is elegant. Marble floors throughout - the bathroom was all marble and very nice! It even had heated towel racks. Our room had an armoire for clothing (with a safe and mini bar) and a plasma TV on the wall. On the down side, the bed was pretty hard. At least a few of the hotel staff speak English, which was helpful. The bar/lounge area has also been rennovated and is quite an elegant place to have a drink. The breakfast room on the roof has great views. The breakfast itself is nothing to write home about, but it's adequate and nice option if you don't like to eat a really big breakfast. Check out the roof terrace at sunset for a beautiful view of the city. You can even see St. Peter's dome. The location for Hotel Veneto is great. Via Veneto is a block away. From there, you can easily walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. A block in the other direction from the hotel is the Villa Borghese. We walked from the hotel down Via Veneto to the Piazza Barberini almost everyday to use the subway. When we were visiting in February, we got a rate of 120 Euros per night. Sounds like it goes up quite a bit in the summer, but then again, all the hotels in Rome do. In Rome, Hotel Veneto is considered both a 3 and 4 star hotel...the 3 star is the old part and the 4 star is the new part. Now that the hotel has been rennovated, I would strongly recommend it - but make sure you get a rennovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, actually pleasant”
Reviews.Author: 2inlovewithItaly
Reviews.Content: Actually good rooms although the bed was horrible. Rooms are nice, clean and tidy. The location is good. The staff at the hotel reception, the elderly men could be a bit nicer, but overall we had a great stay. The bartender (in the way too well lit bar) was very friendly. The only don't in this hotel is breakfast. That is a big no-no! Ok the cornetto's (croissant's to you and me) are ok. But the coffee...mama mia. A big NO-NO. Other then that I can actually recommend it. Neighbourhood....too many good cafe's for breakfast and diner to mention.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Westbarn
Reviews.Content: Great Value: Good location; clean rooms; great shower; very attractive bar; wonderful views from breakfast room. Poor breakfasts; remedial work inside still not finished and quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Near US Embassy”
Reviews.Author: Mardah
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with good service. Unfortuneately, no restaurant, but Continental Breakfast served. Nice bar. Modernized and staff very helpful. Requires transportation to most tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarathetraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Clean, charming atmosphere and friendly staff. Breakfast left a little to be desired, but truly enjoyed the 3 shower heads, flat screen TV and tub with jets. Newly renovated (some areas still under construction) hotel was fantastic. The room was spacious, warm, well-lit and quiet. About 1km for metro station in a wonderful shopping/eatery district. Close to US Embassy and some VERY classy hotels. Not to mention 2 of the hop-on/hop-off tour buses stop just blocks away. Well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Densel
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Wife spent 4 nights in this hotel last week. I was happy with the Hotel and I would stay there again. The price was reasonable and it wasn't too far from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The room was well decorated and clean. The bathroom was nice too, however anyone using the shower can expect the Bathroom floor to be wet when as well. Just one problem, our room faced onto to the back of the building, making an echo area with the backs of othe buildings and the sound of pidgeons early in the morning was quite bad. The breakfast was ok nothing special. The staff were quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but go out for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: remillion
Reviews.Content: Hotel OK, but they might have saved on the marble throughout to provide real coffee at breakfast and not a hideous machine = all the buttons produced the same black transparent gunk. Fruit juice was also from a machine and tasted of flavoured sugar. Othewise OK hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience in Rome during the World Cup!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug36
Reviews.Content: Having booked to go to the Hotel Veneto for 5 days as part of a 10 day visit to Italy in July (when the World Cup was on) both my partner and I were very concerned when we read some of the previous reviews written about this hotel, the renovation works, rude staff etc. I had to write this review as I feel that the hotel was given a raw deal in most of the previous reviews! The staff were all very friendly, helpful with directions and always on hand if we needed anything. The hotel was still undergoing renovations, some of which were close to our room but we did not even notice any noise. The room was lovely, clean and we were welcomed with biscuits and a bottle of fizzy wine which was really nice on our arrival. The bathroom was a bit small but this is Europe and they usually are. The trevi fountain was around 20 minutes walk away, probably not the best place to stay if you don't enjoy walking but as we wanted to explore every inch of Rome I guess it was ideally placed for us. Overall it was a good experience and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a place to crash...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews prior to checking into the hotel. My wife and I booked a month in advance and she was very happy with the online service. It was one of the less expensive places to stay in Rome in June. The reviews made me a little concerned. On the staff, I never had any problem. I thought they were fine and professional. This isn't Disneyland so if you're looking for someone to blow sunshine at you this probably isn't where you want to go. The rooms are small compared to American rooms, but I was in Rome and not planning on spending much time lingering in my room. I was looking for a bed and shower and the Hotel had both and they were fine. The room was clean and was cleaned every day. The noise never bothered me. It wasn't that bad. I mean think about it--you're staying in the middle of a major city. If you're looking for a clean room to crash after running around Rome all day, you'll be fine at this hotel. I thought it was in a good location. I felt safe. Breakfast was fine. The only reason I'm giving it 3-stars instead of 4 is because of the price and even still I don't feel ripped off. But again, it's Rome and everything is more expensive. If any one has any specific questions about my experience at this hotel I'd be happy to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, stuck up place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am sure that you can do better than this hotel. Although the room was nice and quite spacious (much bigger than what you expect in Europe), the staff ruins it all. Unashamedly rude...looks like this has become a part of life for them. The breakfast had some concerns too. No hot items and they were quite reluctant and slow in replenishing food as it got over. The location is average. Its a 15 minute walk to the nearest metro station. No way we are returning!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: KQuaqqa
Reviews.Content: After concluding business in Rome, I switched from a more expensive hotel (Regina Baglione) to the nearby Veneto. In comparison to the 5-star Baglione, the Veneto did not fare too badly! It is in a good, although noisy, location, a few blocks from Via Veneto. I found it very convenient to attractions and public transportation. Spanish Steps about 10 minutes, Barberini and Spagna (via underground) Metro stops less than 10 minute walk. I walked from here to the Vatican, Termini, Piazza de Trevi, etc. Also very convenient to Borghese Gardens. If what you expect is small, but clean rooms, a decent breakfast, and a good location, then I believe your expectations will be met. I can't say much about the staff and service: let's just say they were not openly hostile and leave it at that. (However, the staff and even concierge at the 5-star Regina Baglione were only a tad less unfriendly). + Decent price (I paid E 122/night in June); small, but very clean rooms (I stayed in the old part, overlooking Via Piemonte); small but clean bathroom with everything working!; your own air conditioning controls; a mini-bar fridge for keeping your drinks cold; fast elevator; nice breakfast - large construction project going on - one side of building with scaffolding. Construction affects some services - part of first day of my stay water was turned off; staff seems to regard guests as irritating inconvenience they must tolerate (although this seems prevalant attitude in Rome); roof garden and courtyard not accessible; rather noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: gamblinfool
Reviews.Content: I hope travelers check out various websites before booking a hotel. I know that I won't make that mistake again. This was the second worst hotel at which my sister and I stayed in Italy. The hotel's website is a sham. The 360 degree view on the rooftop terrace is nonexistent because there is no terrace, unless that is also under the scaffold which encapsulated the entire hotel. We didn't even recognize the hotel because of the scaffolding, and yes, just like another reviewer you couldn't open your window because the scaffold prevented that. The room was old, dingy,and depressing. The a/c didn't work. I guess the mold and the a/c vent that surrounded the stuff were just props. Although it was April the day was unseasonably warm, but the noise outside prevented you from keeping the window cracked (remember - you couldn't open it). The beds had a garish gold satin fabric which matched the fabric on the padded walls - what is that all about?The bathroom was clean, with apparently new tiles, but a very old low wattage light bulb. No wash cloths in Europe. You have to be careful about taking a bath, because once you've finished the water that leaves the tub comes up through the drain in the middle of the floor and floods the bathroom. Having been through Katrina last year, I've had my fill of floods - even minor ones. Being a native New Orleanian, I experience on a daily basis what old world charm is ( not anymore though) -- this hotel just has the "old" part down pat. All of the concierges were rude. The only staff who were polite were the porter and one maid. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone -- not even budget travelers, which we were. Had it not been for prepaying our stay, we would have left immediately. Also, other than being walking distance to the Villa Borghese, this hotel is not centrally located to most major attractions. I could go on for at least two pages - but I believe a reader can readily appreciate that this place is dismal.

Reviews.Title: “Building site disaster”
Reviews.Author: sazamataz
Reviews.Content: How this hotel had the cheeck to sell these rooms is beyond me! When we arrived and were shown to our room it was literally a building site, a pneumatic drill was banging away and the whole corridor was filled with dust as was the room.
