The window was covered in scaffold and couldn't be opened. We told the manager straight away that we couldn't stay there and he said he knew and Expedia shouldn't have sold it to us but they could have told Expedia not to.Luckily Expedia did find us another hotel which was difficult as it was Easter. If it wasn't a building site the Venetto is probably an okish 3 star hotel but it wasn't in a great location either.. terrible start to what was otherwise a lovely holiday. >

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied at the Veneto”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Veneto for 3 nights in April. We booked the hotel as part of a package through GO TODAY, so I can't say if it was overpriced per night, etc. However, the hotel was exactly what we were looking for. The room was small, but had all the necessities. It was clean, the bathroom was roomy, there was even a room with a small desk which we used to dump guidebooks and extra papers. It wasn't fancy by any means but the staff was helpful, our room was cleaned well every night, and the staff did a great job recommending restaurants etc. At the time we stayed there the hotel was covered in scaffolding due to some construction but there wasn't any noise that kept us from sleeping. If you are looking for a clean, safe place to put your stuff and rest your tired feet as you tour Rome, this is the place! We were barely in the room so this worked for us. The ONLY thing is - it is pretty far from the main sights- not terrible, but at least 10-15 mins from spanish steps... we couldn't go back to our hotel during the day as we spent most of our time down by the Pantheon. It is however VERY conveniently located to Villa Borghese Park (great museum there), and also the Barberini Metro, which we took quite a few times (total time to Vatican: under 20 minutes!). Inn any case if you are able to walk around with no problem, the location really won't be an issue at all. Lastly, they were happy to do wake-up calls, and their breakfast was quite yummy! I'd be happy to answer any specific questions you have about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LucindaGlos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the begining of our holiday. There was a substantial amount of building work going on at the hotel which was extrememly noisy! We could not open our bedroom window as the building was covered in scaffolding. Our room was very dated.Breakfast was not great, just some stale croissants, bread and jam. Coffee and juice comes out of self-service machine with plastic cups. On a good note the location is not too bad, a short walk from via Veneto, but this area is really expensive. The staff were also fine. I would recommend staying round the spanish steps as the area is far prettier and you didn't seem to get ripped off as much

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review before but have never seen it posted. The hotel is under construction which was never mentioned during booking. The noise and smell were unbearable it was not regular working hours but from 7am until late into the nite. No onsite restaurant as stated. The staff is rude and unresponsive except for one man we flattered to get him to help us. Because of construction showering was nearly impossible. One day no hot water, next no cold, never any water pressure. Staff always acted surprised when we told them and never offered to change our rooms. There was always dust flying around which permeated the air and you could see it settle on the carpet outside our door. They advertised onsite internet which they didnot have much to several of the guests disappointment. They did refund us 1 night stay after I contacted Hotels.com. Overall a 0 star stay at 5 star prices

Reviews.Title: “Compact!”
Reviews.Author: glasgow1-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in April 2006. Pleasant enough hotel, slightly off the beaten track, but only approximately 10 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps (if you don't hang about!). Rooms were unusually decorated, was almost like being in a childrens storybook, but were very clean, with fresh towels and sheets (we thought) each day. There were renovations going on while we were there, which obviously won't be a permanent thing, but quite noisy, so might be worth checking with the hotel to see if the work has been completed if you are looking for a lie in! Would stay here again, once the work has been finished off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved staying at the Veneto! My boyfriend and I just returned from a trip to Rome and chose the Veneto online, not really knowing what to expect. We were both more than satisfied with the choice. The location was perfect - near most everything that we wanted to see and no more than a ten euro cab ride from everything else. Our room was adorable and very comfortable. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and recommended what turned out to be our favorite restaurant. The only down side to the stay was that there is a ton of construction going on right now and workers often worked until late at night and started very early in the morning. It didn't bother us at all, but I can see how it might bother others. Other than that, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “When 3 stars really mean 1.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can one say about the Veneto Hotel. Imagine Fawlty Towers and you have the Veneto Hotel. The staff on reception are good at what they do (registering people)but if they take messages - they don't pass them on. The rest of the hotel staff are hopeless. They set the tables for breakfast once and when the tables become vacant - they don't clean away the dirty dishes. If you want the table you clean it and reset it yourself. This happened everyday I stayed there and I stayed a week. As other people have said there is a musty smell to the place. Don't get a room overlooking the street as it is very noisey, get a room over the rear courtyard - it will be cooler (in the summer) and quieter. This hotel is centrally located but in very quiet area on weekends and evenings when all the other businesses in the area are closed. Now I know what it is like, I would stay there again as it is relatively inexpensive, centrally located and much better than some of the other 'more expensive' hotels in the area. Use this hotel as a place to sleep only and don't expect anything from the staff - because you won't get it.

Reviews.Title: “building going on - no restaurant - most unsatissfactory”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: when we arrivied, renovations were taking place, no restaurant facilites which were advertised - builders hammering and drilling from 7am in the morning - a long way from attractions although the hotel advetrised 10 minutes walk to these places. I would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone. Any other guest staying same time felt the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4staronly
Reviews.Content: Myself & my husband went to Rome on a weekend break in March. The weather was perfect for sightseeing and the crowds were not too bad at all. We got a bus from the airport to the Station Termini (only €6 each) and then it was only a 10 min walk to the hotel - avoid ALL taxis, total rip off! The hotel was in a great location; the rooms were small and basic, but very clean - the shower was fantastic, exactly what you needed after a long day sightseeing! The roof terrace was closed, but there were signs to say that it should be open again by the summer time. We had a lovely view from the room, the shutters opened right out and it was really nice in the evening. Three days was perfect, we got to see everything we wanted to see. I loved everything about Rome - the people, the sights, and especially the food :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarrieC76
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Veneto is a great hotel to stay in for its price and location. It's about a 15 minute walk to the metro station, which can take you to all the major sites. Otherwise, it's about 20 minutes walking to the center of Rome where everything is anyway. The rooms itself at the hotel were perfect. They were clean, big enough, and the bathrooms were in great condition with hot water. There is a complimentary breakfast each morning; a simple breakfast to get you on your feet. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit back!

Reviews.Title: “First class service”
Reviews.Author: fined4times
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room for 4 nights at the end of January. Room was large and comfortable and we were greeted with a complimentary bottle of wine and biscuits upon arrival. Fabulous hotel- very Italien and great value for money. However do not count on hot tea or coffee at breakfast. Juice for me was fine and the breakfat more than adequate. The staff were some of the nicest people I have come across. Very helpful and patient. All the main tourist sights are within walking distance but the Hotel is not beside the Trevi Fountain. It is a 15 minute walk away. Please be careful of getting ripped off by the taxi drivers. Most are fine - but some will try to overcharge. Also hold tight to your purses ladies if you take a bus to the Vatican. Do arrange tickets for the Papal Audience about 2 weeks before you go and don't miss the Sistine Chapel. They stop selling tickets at 12.20 pm and it closes around 3pm.

Reviews.Title: “A questionable experience”
Reviews.Author: goingtosail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Veneto in Jan.2006. It is sort of close to the train station but far from everything else. We are walkers so the end of the night walk back, or the mid afternoon walk to refresh before heading out again were a pain. The room was very nice, the breakfast terrible, the price good for 3 people, the service mediochre. The (cold) shower drained so slowly I thought it was broken but the desk didn't care. It was so so-so, I couldn't recommend it or want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Veneto- Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Above Average!! I met my fiance in Rome when he had a 2-week R & R from the Iraq war and our first 3 nights we stayed in Hotel Veneto. The room was sort of small (most like all of the rooms in Italy), but very quaint and adorable. We were just delighted the whole time. The staff was very friendly and it was overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_clh
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot throughout Europe over the last couple of years, so I have a pretty good idea what to expect. I must admit that my initial impression of the room was not a very good one. It was the smallest room I've ever seen, the main light in the bathroom was not working, the toilet seat was broken, and the remote control to the TV was nowhere to be found (and the TV was mounted high in a corner, so was out of reach). I walked down to the front desk, since no one answered the phone when I called... The staff made every effort to appease me, and even showed me another vacant room, which was acceptable. However, they would then not allow me to switch to that room for some reason; it made no sense! By this time, it was after midnight and I was too tired to argue. In the end the only thing they corrected was bringing another remote to the TV. It didn't take me long to get over the TV because there was a lot of static on all the channels. Oh well. I didn't go to Rome to watch TV, but it's always nice to have the background noise. The bed was very comfortable and the noise level was not bad at all. The shower was good, although the water temperature varies a little, but that is usually the case in these older hotels. The breakfast was acceptable with lots of breads, cereal, yogurt, and several coffee options. If you expect to get eggs, sausage, or any other high protein items for breakfast, bring your own or go to a restaurant! It was enough to hold me over until I could grab something delicious for lunch. The staff was neither overly friendly or helpful, but not rude either. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again simply because it is in a great location, clean, and reasonably priced. If you are looking for a plush, romantic hotel with all the amenities, you will be disappointed at the Veneto. If you just want a place to sleep and shower, this is perfect. It is within walking distance to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, and several great shopping areas. They give discounts to Embassy personnel, so ask about that if you qualify. It is also just around the corner from the U.S. Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what it is”
Reviews.Author: latte4me
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel somewhere between the high-end of budget hotels to the low end of the mid-range hotels, so don't expect fluffy white towels, spacious rooms, concierge service, etc. Rooms were clean, and although our room faced the street, the window panes were thick enough to block out street noise. Staff was polite, although I didn't expect them to serve as tour guides. Location was excellent, with some destinations within walking distance and a bus line close by for other sites (Colosseum , Vatican, etc.), Personally, I never eat the hotel breakfast because you can miss out on some great local color so we ate at a place just around the corner (turn left). There's also a Tabachi shop next door to the coffee bar for bus tickets. As for the rates - this is Rome, and lodging is generally expensive. Fortunately, there are plenty of discounted rooms available, so you don't have to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to historic Rome. Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer13
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading reviews on Trip advisor about staying here but it was great. The hotel room was your typical European hotel. The rooms were large enough and very clean. The satelite tv worked. We had a double room with a whirl pool tube. Let's face it you do not go on vacation in Rome to spend most of your time in the room I thought the staff was helpful and polite. I had no problem with any of the staff. They were very accomodating. We even had a drink our last night in the small lounge/bar that had a flat screen plasma tv. The hotel was in an excellent location within walking distance to everything. There was a taxi stand just 2 blocks from the hotel. The metro station was a 10 minute walk. There is a bus stop outside of the hotel. There were plenty of resturants and cafes within a 5 to 10 minute walk of the hotel. The area was very safe. We were two woman who walked back late at night and there was never a problem. Also the hallways in the hotel are monitored by cameras. The breakfast was good. There was ceral, croissants, rolls, italian bread, and yogart. If you ask they will bring you a capacino or an expresso free of charge. It is your typical european breakfast. We were more then pleased with the hotel. I would definetly stay here again and recommend it to anyone who wants to stay within walking distance of the major sites. We spent a week here and would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with the Veneto”
Reviews.Author: maccafromheaven
Reviews.Content: Very, very happy with the rooms, service and above all the price of the Hotel Veneto which was cheaper than almost all the other 3 star hotels in the area! Naturally, I did my research before travelling and considering the varying reviews approached this hotel with more than a little trepidation... I couldn't have been happier when I checked into my room, spacious, fresh, air conditioning, satelite tv and an immaculate white marble/tiled bathroom. Breakfast was typically Italian the highlight of where the fresh croissants which had a variety of fillings including jams, nutella, cold custard (surprisingly very nice) etc. There were no bacon and eggs but, like most modern Brits I only have that on a Sunday morning. Location wise the hotel is great, only 10 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps which is where all the action is i.e. Via dei Condotti, shopping and the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon are only another 15 minutes walk away. You can get the metro to the Vatican from Barberini metro stop which is a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel Veneto. I am going back to Rome next year and thoroughly intend to stay at the Hotel Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Mistake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights leaving on 26 Oct. We paid close to $200 a night for this awful hotel. Windows open or closed the traffic noise was LOUD. Our air conditioning was not working, so we had to sleep with the windows open. As if the traffic werent enough, the plumbing made loud gurgling noises whenever anyone in the vicinity used it. Staff was indifferent. Yuk! If we hadnt paid in advance, we would have left after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: DrLAM
Reviews.Content: Hotel Veneto has a crazy array of reviews posted. My stay was just okay. The room was a good size, although decorated entirely in pink. The room and the bathroom were clean, but had a musty, mouldy smell. It's location is great, and for this alone I would recommend staying there. It is around the corner from the American Embassy in a nice area. Breakfast was included in the rate, but was terrible. Some of the hotel staff were more than accomodating. Others answered my questions adequately but didn't do so with a smile. I guess it depends on who you get. Overall - it was okay. Not as good as the raving reviews, not as bad as the terrible reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Super Special Offer Stay 4 Pay 3”
Reviews.Author: pottyaboutitaly
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 13 day trip to Italy where I had a fantastic time thanks mainly to the reviews and information contained within this web site. In Rome we stayed at the 3 Star Hotel Veneto taking advantage of their special stay 4 pay 3 offer which was remarkable given just how busy Rome is in October. We checked around and ended up booking directly with the hotel as no other site could match that offer. The hotel is ideally located only minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and some great shops just off the via Condotti. The metro stop Barberini (line A) is only 10 minutes walk away providing you with a simple and quick connection to the Vatican and Saint Peters. Our room was spacious and contained mini bar, satelite t.v. (bbc world and cnn) plus air conditioning and en-suite bathroom which had both bathroom and shower. Breakfast was lovely and the croissants or cornetty melt in the mouth... shame they don't convert the loft restaurant by putting in some big glass windows so one can enjoy the view of Rome whilst having breakfast. Finally, on the first day when we arrived the hotel had a slight smell i.e. stale... we enquired what this was and the receptionist informed us that it if it rains excessively then the water levels rise and unfortunately many buildings in the area have this problem... they are working on it and are pressurising Rome council to do something! We will definitely return especially when its Sunny :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a nice location. A little noisy in the mornings from passing traffic, but that's Rome for you ! Staff were ok. The room was very clean, though a little on the 'tired' side and is probably due a refurb. This was the only gripe with it really. Would stay here again, in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the budget minded 20s/30s”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was located close by to a conference we were attending. We had booked well in advance and paid only 520.80 euro for 7 nights twin-share including breakfast in summer: it was a bargain. Many of the other people from the conference stayed elsewere and paid a lot more for a lot less. Yes, the lobby is clean and pretty and the rooms perhaps don't match up to the same standard. Our room was totally fine, though we were not sure if the aircon was really working. The decor is ye-oldie-Victorian with a few bits of peeling paint, but who cares? We had comfortable twin beds, a spa-like shower with multiple jets and a huge window that you could look out of and watch Rome go by. The breakfast in the rooftop dining area was the possibly the best part: juice, pastries & jam, choice of cereals and yoghurts, several kinds of juice and coffee (albeit from a help-yourself machine). Excellent if you want to eat up before a big day out. The staff were more overwhelmed/overworked than rude: they tried to help us with directions for a theatre they had never heard of before & looked it up online & in the yellow pages. You don't come to Rome for the hotel staff, you come for the excellent food and art, both of which are nearby. We came and went late at night and always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: thegrant
Reviews.Content: There seem to be a lot of different opinions as to the quality of the hotel Veneto. When we stayed in August we found it to be well worth the price. The room was fine if a little old looking decoration wise. Staff were very friendly and helpful. There was plenty for breakfast although they could have had more staff clearing the breakfast room. There was little noise both inside and outside the hotel at night The location is good enough, close to Via Veneto and about 15mins walk to the Spanish Steps. The metro is about 10mins walk and there is a bus route that passes by the hotel. There is also a taxi rank about 2 mins walk away. There are plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance though some on Via Veneto can be a bit of a rip off

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!! Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I, who are very Italian ourselves and know the meaning of Italian hospitality - we're shocked and appauled at the service of this hotel. The staff was so rude and inconsiderate, they actually got annoyed with us when we asked for directions! When we got there, the electricity for the whole building was out and they walked us through dark hallways and plopped us in an un air-conditioned room in the middle of August. When the building did get its power back, only the lobby was air conditioned - we spent three out of a five night stay sweating every night! You were barely greeted going to and from the hotel - nor at breakfast. The hotel said there was roof-top dining and when we got there, the restuarant was no longer even open! The ONLY decent thing about this hotel was that it was a two block walk from Via Veneto - however, our first night we were sick and just wanted to get out of there! Not worth the "bargain" price whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Serious disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TheNorthernMonkey
Reviews.Content: Just got back from honeymoon in Positano and Rome. Had booked this hotel for 3 nights but checked out after one. As it was our honeymoon we booked a "suite". The room we were given would be more adequately described as a family room. It had a spare room which had a single bed in it. That's all - no other furniture at all. The main room was large (the bathroom tiny) but apart from that it had no other redeeming features. I am sure it had not been redecorated or refurnished in 20 years or more. I literally saw nothing, in the room or around the corridors and stairs, which was not scratched, tatty or broken in some way or other. If I'd been paying for a backpackers hostel I'd have been fairly happy - but I was paying for a suite in what I expected to be a quality hotel. The air conditioning worked 25% of the time and when it did it gave out a loud buzz. Needless to say we got zero sleep. It's perhaps revealing that when we checked out early the receptionist asked no questions whatsoever. We got the distinct impression our early departure was commonplace. We were fortunate to get a room at the Aleph nearby. It was excellent if a tad more expensive. It did not spoil our holiday thankfully. But please be aware what sort of standard this hotel is before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spend three great nights in Hotel Veneto in August. It's a great base for discovering the wonders of Rome and it's breakfasts are hearty enough to keep you going all day. Reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Superb Cheap Last Minute Hotel in Rome near Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: chocolateclaire
Reviews.Content: superb value for money hotel located in the heart of the city center near all of the major boutique shopping outlets and baroque tourist attractions like Spanish Steps and Via Veneto plus Trevi Fountain and Pantheon are only minutes walk away. Breakfast was lovely served in the airy and bright loft with nice views of rootop Rome and the Basilica of Saint Patrizio right in front of the hotel. Nicola the grey haired reception manager was relaxed, amiable and most helpful when it came to restaurant suggestions and help with directions... he is however, very busy so time your questions well otherwise you may be waiting a while. The rooms were above average but our television had reception problems for a few of the channels but who cares as when in Rome you are hardly going to sit in front of the Box... I would suggest this hotel to anyone on a medium budget and who wants to book last minute as the rates were brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Grth
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at the Hotel Veneto. Having read many positive but also some very negative reviews of the hotel on Trip Advisor, we were unsure as to what we would find when we got there. What we generally look for when we go on a Citybreak is a clean, comfortable hotel in a good location, and good value for money. At just over 100 euro per night, the Hotel Veneto fitted the bill perfectly. We didn't encounter any of the problems experienced by some other reviewers. Our room was on the second floor, at the front of the hotel. There was traffic on the street outside (amazingly enough), but when you closed the window the noise was minimal. The air conditioning worked fine and we had no problem sleeping. The room was clean, had a large comfortable double bed, spotless sheets every night, and a sparkling bathroom with a good powerful shower. TV reception sometimes wasn't great, but so what, we didn't go to Rome to stay in the room and watch CNN. The hotel has a beautiful airy breakfast room with views over the city. What you get for breakfast varies in hotels all over the Continent but we had no complaints about what we got here- a good choice of cereals, a variety of fresh croissants, breads and preserves, with cappuccino made for you on the spot. Yes, the fruit juice was from a machine (but so what, it tasted OK) The staff at reception were not a problem either. Personalities obviously differ, but any time we asked someone at the desk for advice, they were more than willing to help. They were also efficient and friendly without being obsequious. In fact we found Italians in generally in the streets and on the buses very helpful. I would describe the situation of the Veneto as borderline central. From the hotel it's a 12 minute walk, mostly downhill, to the Spanish Steps ( and a further distance to most of the other principal attractions). It's a lovely walk on a sunny Roman summer morning, but at the end of a hard day's sightseeing, coming uphill, rather more tiring! However, there is a bus from the centre which stops on the Via Veneto, 2 mins away from the hotel. We did walk home late at night though and felt completely safe. From reading the other reviews, it's obvious that some people have had genuine problems at the Veneto, but in our opinion, and from our experience of the hotel, much of the criticism is unreasonable and unfair. On our last evening, we threw our coins in the Trevi Fountain, which traditionally means that we will be going back to Rome again. We'll have absolutely no hesitation in returning to the Hotel Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, rooms are a lottery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from July 3-8 2005. We had booked a double room through its website, as had 2 friends with whom we were travelling. We were given a cramped, stale-smelling room (305) with a view of the other internal walls of the hotel. This could have been bearable had it not been for the broken airconditioner and the bathroom, in which the toilet was almost right up against the side wall and the bidet was BUILT INTO THE SMALL SHOWER CUBICLE. As the water was so slow to drain, the water rapidly filled up to the brim of the shower basin, so whatever filth remained in the drain came up too. As a result one had to balance on the raised sides of the cubicle which was downright dangerous. Our friends' room (319) was nice, albeit smaller, with a nice new bathroom and a street view. From seeing other guests complain about their rooms it is clear that although the type of room may be the same (single/double etc) the rooms themselves are not the same and it is a lottery as to what you will get. The reception staff are quite surly, though Gianni and Nicola were OK. The one guy who seems to be the one most commonly referred to in other reviews was Paulo, who was rude, racist, and clearly yearning for a better job. When we politely complained about the room, the shower and the aircon, he just said 'This is a 3-star hotel, what do you expect? It's not going to be perfect'.(!) He said the hotel was full so we could not change rooms, but he'd send someone to check the aircon while we went for dinner (which he did not). The next day we spoke to Nicola who said they were not full and to change rooms would not be a problem. We changed to room 418 which was large, had a nice new bathroom, and was still the same room category we had booked. Breakfast was very mediocre so we brought in our own cheeses and cold cuts. Roof terrace was closed and the hotel was not offering a dinner service. The owners use reviews from Trip Advisor on their website yet do not seem to act on the many complaints and negative reviews published. So, we will never stay there again and certainly do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky hotel in a fantastic Location with attractions nearby!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day break and stayed at this hotel. It was fantastic. There are two metro stations close by, good transport links in terms of buses and good rest. Pizza Pepperon was lovely...the Pasta was fab! The hotel itself was close to Spanish steps, Trevie fountain etc and villa borgeuse - a lovely park which offers hot air balloon rides for around 11euro......don't miss this. The hotel room was very clean albeit a bit small but the showers are great after a long day’s walk and sightseeing. Reasonably priced when I went for a 3*. Breakfast was ok not bad.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Veneto
HotelInfo.Address: Via Piemonte 63, 00187 Rome, Italy
